review_body: As lovely a hotel as you could ever want. My first stay there was the first week it opened. Not even the lobby had been completed; nor the comfortable lounge on the 27th floor. And still, I knew this place was special. The rooms are spotless; the service, outstanding; the opportunity to relax and enjoy coffee and snacks in that top floor lounge, comforting; the location, ideal. And the reception that you receive as you enter makes you feel like you've lived there all your life. Jillian's warm, bubbly but sincere personality welcomes you as soon as you enter and Tre's smile and more reserved but ever so endearing demeanor makes you feel so comfortable after a lengthy, tiring travel experience. You know that their offers to assist you with anything you need are genuine. It's the best way I can think of to start off my stay in the Big Apple. It goes without saying I can't wait to return. My idea of perfection.

Good location and polite staff made up for the shortcomings otherwise might rate lower. The aircon is noisy and the lift broke down twice in a week causing the waiting time for the lift to be long. And lift buttons somehow weren't always working, seen it happened to many other guests too.

My trip was amazing because of Elizabeth without her I would’ve never had such a great experience!, with such servitude and reliability she really care about the guest ! The hotel needs to keep this jewel.

We stayed in a superior room with kitchenette this was great. The facilities in the room were excellent and we didn’t have any major issues. The air con is a little noisy however it does mask the noise of the traffic etc. No room safes just a common room that staff give you access to. The lounge was a great service and very handy. Wine hour 5-6pm was fab!We would definitely stay here again as the location was fab and the facilities were perfect for a city break.

This was an overnight trip for me - great location for access to all of central NYC. K=Lots of restaurants in all price points within walking distance. I live in the Tri-state region and often come in for overnights (business and pleasure.) Will definitely stay here again.

We were strongly satisfied in this hotel. It is small but comfortible, we aprociate good price. There is a nice terrace on the roof, you could owerviev streets near to you and the life on Manhattan. Recommend it.

This hotel exceeded my expectations! I was definitely hesitant after reading some reviews, but my worries were cast aside when I arrived. Jillian and Greg welcomed me when I checked in and never ceased to give me great food recommendations and places to go. The only thing I wish could’ve been improved upon was the air conditioning unit in the room. It was very noisy and I had trouble adjusting the room temperature.

My fiend and I booked and overninght stay at the Club Quarters Grand Central. WE found the staff very helpful and the room very pleasant and spacious. We agreed the price was very reasonable and was centrally located near many restaurants and other food places as well as Broadway. We will definitely come to Club Quarters again and highly recommend it to all our family and friends.

We had a few drinks at the Bistro bar and got great customer service from Ricardo - he is usually in on weekends but we were lucky to have him at the bar on a Tuesday. Plan to visit the quiet yet fun place again

Be sure to download their app. It makes check-in a breeze! Snacks are available at all times, self-service laundry and fitness room are also available. The proximity to Grand Central Terminal is very useful.

Compact and functional room which is well maintained and clean.I just like the look and feel. Friendly helpful staff. 27th floor has a terrace and tea and coffee if you don't want to sit in your room. Plus a Happy Hour

I chose this location for my birthday to house my girlfriend and myself for a full weekend Friday through Monday. The lady whom checked me us in was a delight but everything that followed was a disaster. The room had a terrible view. The TV internet and Chromecast didn't work. I requested a spoon one night it took forever to get to me and the night before I requested to have the internet and Chromecast working they said they'd send someone up and they never did. There are no ice machines on any floor except on the top floor and the elevator situation is miserable as there are only three elevators and they use the three main elevators as a freight as well. so even getting to your room sometimes can be a very long wait and trying to get back down to go somewhere and take forever as well. overall I would never stay at this specific location again.

Hotel seems to be built for the business traveler. The lounge and bottle water service on each floor were great. The room was very clean. I didn't get to try the restaurant on this trip. I'll have to try it on the next one. I'll definitely be back.

The lounge was filled with groups doing business (even during the cocktail hour). It was not very relaxing. The room was nicely maintained, but the sink was partially clogged and barely drained. Elevators ran on key cards and this did not work very well.

I always know what to expect from CQ in the way of great location, amenities, service, and overall value for the price paid. I ALWAYS look for CQ FIRST whenever travel planning will take me to a city with a major downtown location. Special shout out to Greg for giving consistently good advice, directrions, and excellent overall service. Two improvement items for this property: water pressure for the shower and assuring there is early morning staffing for "Living Room".

Hotel very clean and customer focus. Lot of facilities and location was very good ( close to Grand Central) if you want to visit Manhattan by foot, metro. 15 minutes from all nice places like Times Square, Chrysler building, Empire State and the fashion avenue.

I've shared my views in the preliminary screen. Why am I being asked again to submit my review?This is definitely a very poor use of my time, and I highly recommend that you adjust your processes to reflect this.

Location was great, reasonably priced and your clerks at the front desk were very helpful. I was charged a deposit for each night on top of the room charges, but was told it would be refunded when I checked out ... 5-7 days.

I never stayed at Club Quarters but I decided to give it a try. I absolutely loved it and will definitely stay again. Everything was excellent! I liked the fact that they provided water for the guests and a yoga mat if you chose to workout in the room. Although the room was small, it was well thought out. I did have an issue with the television - however - someone promptly came up to my room to take care of it. Staying at this hotel made my short stay in NYC a great one.

I stay here occasionally on business, and am always impressed by the very friendly and attentive staff. The combination of location, excellent customer service, and clean comfortable accommodations make this a winner and I look forward to the next trip to NY. A big plus is the the complimentary happy hour on a high floor (if you’re lucky Jillian is serving!) with an incredible view.

Room was okay, hospitality was fine. My qualms are with the facilities fee, which reception said are for “wifi” and other amenities that are advertised in the hotel and on booking sites as ‘free’. The facilities fee is mentioned during the booking process - so fair enough, but don’t advertise things as FREE when it isn’t and you’re paying a pretty hefty price for them at the end of your stay.

The service was amazing! This is my second stay with the chain. Elizabeth made my stay so comfortable! She is an amazing asset to the hotel! Guests should feel privileged to have her assist them! Kudos!

We loved the room , the location. It was great to have bottled water and snacks . The only reason for the 4 is that the ac was dripping and making the carpet wet and the management did not take care of it before we left.

Great central location with easy access to most that the city has to offer. Be clear, this is a high class dormitory, not a full service hotel but for most travellers who might prefer to choose where they eat and drink it's a great, well priced solution.

What makes this hotel truly great, is it’s staff, we had arrived as a surprise for my father’s 60th, the hotel staff went out of their way to make sure the surprise was kept, the reception staff were amazing and it felt like they were just as excited as us, we would definitely stay here again, service here is amazing, the view from our room was also pretty awesome!

This hotel is over priced for the services provided. Additional charges for the supposedly free wine hour on the roof. Hidden charges added to bill when checking out in the very small lobby with guests with luggage waiting for elevators, checking out and checking in.

review_body: Room on the 4th floor with blinded windows and a large noisy aircondition unit outside. Airconditioning unit inside the room was very loud. The room was further on dampy and due to that a bit smelly..

Location of hotel is perfect and service was great by the staff! They are willing to accommodate to request. Cleanliness of room is there unless you are super particular about it. Would return to CQ chain again!

the room was big enough for 2 persons. clean. personnel were very friendly and helpful. Always smiling and assisting in any query. we stayed there for 10 days and everything was great. they have a "open wine"from 5 to 6.

I visited with my sister for 3 nights and it was amazing. The staff is extremely helpful and nice. Great location a few blocks from Grand Central Station, so it is easy to move around. There are snacks in the 27th floor, enough for breakfast, generating a space to socialize with other guests and feel at ease.

Perfect location for getting around Manhattan and other areas on NY.Great rooms.Free happy hour drinks and snacks on 27th floor, between 1700-1800 hrs.Very clean.Staff very helpful and attentive.Our room was spacious, considering where the hotel is.Grand Central station is literally the other side of the road.
First time to NYC, hotel is in a great location if you want to be in the thick of it. The staff were amazing especially Greg and Elizabeth. We will definitely be back again. Good times thank you NYC!

Booked as a " blind" choice on a travel website, I knew the location would be great ( across the street from Grand Central ) but didn't expect the level of service and conveniences available. A 27th floor " living room" with outdoor terrace and comp snacks 24hours, daily " happy hour" with wine at 5pm, great restaurant located in same building that gave 15% off for hotel guests ( Davio's is it's name), pleasant and KNOWLEDGEABLE staff, decor etc...I will reccomend highly...

There was so much to enjoy about the Club Quarters in NYC. I was extremely pleased with the staff, service, room, and the happy hour on the 27th floor was definitely a wonderful experience that turned into one of the highlights of our stay at the hotel.

Friendly staff, quiet, free Wifi, few blocks walking from Broadway and Times Square, easy check and check out. Key card for everything from room to elevator, lot of shopping available. bed was comfortable, spacious for NYC hotel room!

This hotel is literally across the street from Grand Central station. It is withing walking distance of Times Square, the Promenade and the UN. What you cant walk to you can take the subway too. Great places to eat within a block or 2. The Staff was great with help on which subways to take and where. In room free coffee! Smart TV you can either use your phone on or use your own amazon or Netflix accounts.

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights on a business trip. The rooms are basic but very clean and a good size. The check in / check out was quick and efficient. The 24 hour gym is small but has good equipment and there are also yoga mats and bands available in the room.

Not worth. The AC was too noisy, I asked them 3 times to fix it and the problem wasn’t solved. The nice things such as snacks and wine are not worth if simple things are not working, such as AC working properly

The good: Clean, friendly and accommodating staff, extra effort all aroundThe bad: Mis-sized toilet seats that won't stay up, hard uncomfortable bed, outlet next to bed not working (multiple calls to fix), no refrigerator in room

Our trip at Hotel Boutique was fabulous, and we owe it all to Elizabeth! She has the best energy and was so willing to make sure our trip was nothing but the best. We will absolutely be back and we can’t wait to see Elizabeth. Thank you!!!

OMG!!! I am up on 27th floor for wine at 5:00. As usual, I’m here almost all weekends. One of the biggest pleasures was having Chris here hosting wine at 5. We loved him and all the other guests loved him. To just now find out he is no longer with CQ is a big disappointment. A HUGE disappointment!!! Whomever made the decision to let him go, made a very bad decision. A very bad customer relation decision. Did any of you ‘decision makers’ ever see him in action? If not, that was mistake #1. You all made a truly bad corporate decision here. He was a valued employee here in your guests opinion and someone really screwed up. Shame shame.

Completely enjoyed my stay there. Staff was great room was clean and cozy. Location was perfect. The price was the correct one. I had a great time there. Bed was really comfortable. Close to shopping and good restaurants.

We were in NYC for a wedding and stayed for 6 wonderful nights! We would highly recommend this hotel!!! It’s in a great location so it’s walkable to many areas.It was fantastic from the warm and friendly staff (especially David Scott who always made a point to acknowledge you with a friendly gesture) to the room to amenities the hotel has to offer! We were greeted warmly at check in and were upgraded to a bigger room on the top floor! It was awesome!!! Thank you, CQ Grand Central for a fabulous stay! We’ll definitely be back!!!

CQ gives you what you expect from a hotel without any negatives or surprises. It is clean, reliable and comfortable. The service is professional, efficient, reliable and friendly. Their formula delivers a comfortable and relaxing experience without any negative drama. The lounge, with its amenities and snacks is an added benefit.

disorganized front desk, bad lighting in room, photos are not accurate, community iron in hallway, carpet was stained and sheets had pulls and tears in them the bed was comfortable and the location was excellent. TV didn't work and the seating area was very uncomfortable and hard to work on (table was bolted to floor)

I had given up at writing these reviews until my stay here at the Club Quarters Grand Central. I have been staying here a few times a month for work and can not say enough amazing things. The evening front desk staff go above and beyond to accommodate and make you feel welcome. The rooms are always clean and quite and are designed well. The rooftop club room is excellent for a great cup of coffee and views of the city. I will try to come here as much as I can while here on business.

review_body: The hotel had everything you would hope for to be comfortable on a business trip. I upgraded to Standard Room to have a little more space, which was definitely worth it. There were light snacks during daytime hours with fruit and granola bars at breakfast. The only complimentary food/bev amenity available all day was the coffee (which was great!) The hotel is clean, comfortable, has great internet, and is efficient. Also, the 5-6 p.m. free wine happy hour was great! Chris, the hotel staff member who facilitated the happy hour, is awesome. He made it a good time and got folks talking with each other. I would stay there again!

They charge $30 a day extra for use of amenities on departure that you have no choice over or knowledge of in advance. pretty crappy behaviour. The staff are pleasant enough but the rooms are pretty small

Nice hotel one block from Grand Central. Clean, new, nice marble shower. Small room but not unusual for New York standards. Relatively cheap, got a room for $350 when everything else in the area was four to five hundred. No frills, no minibar no restaurant on premise although there's a third-party restaurant that does room service. Happy hour with wine for everyone on top floor. Good spot for business. I don't think any work out facilities, but I'm not sure. Friendly staff.

We booked a room with kitchenette and expected great things based on previous online reviews and the price per night. First impressions were ok, friendly staff and we were checked in right away. It appeared our request for a room on a higher floor was accommodated as we were put in 1904. The room had some definite wear and tear, and large water marks on the ceiling areas. Whatever, no drips, we didn't say anything about it. Quiet except for the sound of neighbour's door slamming and extremely loud AC (though it effectively cooled the room, so pro con). All seemed well but on the fourth night of our stay water started pouring from a vent in the ceiling onto our living room floor. Thank goodness we were in the room and were able to put a garbage can under the drip. When we called reception, they sent someone up to look but said their repairmen would not return til the next day. When we asked if any other rooms were available, they only offered a lower grade room on the second floor due to 'availability of room types'; a room on the 17th floor was promised to us the next day. To us, either a same or better grade room should have been offered to compensate. So we slept through the night with the dripping. Then, when it came time to move us, we were then told the room would be on the 15th floor, not 17th. Clearly they gave the room away. Maybe not a big deal in any other city, but for light sleepers in NYC, not the greatest. Still, we sucked it up and were determined not to let it ruin our trip. The clincher came when we checked out and were told by reception that "we were good" and had no outstanding charges. A week after arriving home, we noticed a charge for $150 or so on my visa. An email to the hotel asking what it was for said it was for room taxes, and that our third party booking site should have informed us, and that it wasn't their responsibility to do so on checkout! Appalling. To future hoteliers, I hope you use this as a case study in what not to do. Shame, as the location is convenient. Pick a different hotel!

Everything about the room and the facility was top notch. The room was excellent with good lighting, a fine desk and chair to work and everything handy. The TV worked and was easy to use. The bathroom was perfect ... everything within easy reach and all the essentials available. Good shower, as usual.

We really enjoyed our 2 nights at this hotel and wished we could have stayed longer. Our standard room was very nice (minor thing was our room phone hand set wasn’t working but we really didn’t need it). Trey was very nice in finding us a room so we could check in early and would always offer any help whenever we saw him. Chris ALWAYS greeted us whenever we saw him. He was very entertaining during the 5wine time. We will definitely return on our next NY visit. Our thanks to the wonderful staff who made our visit so pleasant!

I booked this place based on previous tripadvisor reviews and the photos on the CQ website, I now wish I had ignored both as they are so misleading.This is a hotel so in need of refurbishment, we booked a suite and were given a room on the fifth floor, it was so dark and dingy and only had room for one person to comfortably sit which was crazy. Everything about the room was so dated, the aircon is the noisiest we have experienced and the smell form the sink drain was just over powering, the cracked bathroom sink didn't help either. The Hotel was full so when we requested to move room they couldn't accommodate this and so we checked out, but only after we waited an age for the supervisor who was at home to confirm that the full refund would be given! even then they couldnt release the hold placed on my credit card!This isnt a hotel that justifies its 4 star rating, after a much needed refurbishment it may do but at this time its an overpriced 3 star business hotel. NYC has far better hotels to spend your hard earned cash in, if you want to ensure a great time give this one a miss.

I went to NYC for business for 4 days and transferred to Club Quarters for the weekend after my business was completed. Upon arrival I was greeted by David Scott. I explained I was waiting for my husband and he told me to make myself comfortable in the lobby. The check-in process was easy and our room on the 5th floor was comfortable and clean. We were pleasantly surprised to find out that the hotel had a lounge on the 27th floor which had complimentary snacks, coffee and tea. I made good use of this area late at night when I had some work to do. The views from the balcony were also amazing. It offered lots of seating. In addition to this, they had a water station close to the elevator. David and the team were friendly and made us feel welcomed every time we arrived into the hotel.I will definitely use this property again and would prefer this property for my next business trip.

The hotel is cheap in comparison to others in the area. It is very modern and new. I really enjoyed my stay. And was able to watch Netflix using my account on the room’s tv, which was nice. The furniture is modern, they have keurig machines in the rooms and bottled water available on each floor.

The Club Quarters was an absolute pleasure to stay at. The location of the hotel gives you quick access to the best spots in NYC including Times Square and beyond. The room was also great. The staff was super friendly and very helpful.

The location was close to everything that you would want to see in New York, the room was very clean and comfortable and the hotel staff went above and beyond to assist us in every way that they could.

I have stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. This hotel is supposedly renovated but in my opinion it is not 100% renovated. You can still feel the tiredness of the room, bedding, tiles, walsl in the washroom. Nevertheless, my husband and I enjoyed this hotel very much due to the location and service(coffee, free laundry and friendly staff), until I came home and checked my credit card statement. There was a charge of USD86. I was dumbfounded and contacted the hotel. According to the hotel it is the resort fee. Once again I found this extremely unreasonable. To avoid the resort fee or any kind of surprise hidden fee, I already have contacted CQ prior to my booking. In fact I have contacted Grand central branch + Wall St branch in NYC. These two branches of Club Quarters in NYC have confirmed me that there is no resort fee. Since I got the confirmation of no hidden fees by the hotel I went through and booked the hotel. However when I explained this, the hotel simply responded that there is a resort fee if you book through the third party. I found this answer this extremely unjust so I requested him to lift the resort fee. He refused and asked me to contact the manager. Later of the day I have contacted the manager and the manager confirmed again that he could not do anything about this and just reconfirmed that there always a resort fee if booking is done through the third party. As a customer we have a right to know all the exact details to make the reasonable decision. When I was requiring regarding the resort fee before the booking, no staff specified that I need to make a booking through their websites to avoid the resort fee charge! If I have known about this detail, I would not have booked this hotel. But now that I have already stayed and left the hotel they simply charged on my credit card. The hotel should have informed me PROPERLY on the first place the details and terms/conditions of the resort fee! I feel like I have been ripped off for no reason. Also when I was checking in and out there was no mention of the resort fee at all. It was simply charged on my credit card. I'm curious whether everyone who booked this hotel through the third party is aware of this nonsense. If there was no issue regarding the resort fee I have given 5 star on this hotel. But everyone please be aware of this misleading resort fee charge.

A fantastic hotel with lots more going for it than you might know at first. The reception is small but I arrived at a good time and check in was instant. When full with people checking in and going up in the elevator it can look a little chaotic, but do not go on first impressions. The rooms are fine but there is more than meets the eye. Food can be ordered direct to the room from dozens of places or from the downstairs Italian place. The 27th floor room and balcony has free snacks, fruit and drinks all day (tea and coffee then wine from five). The internet is always free both in room and up on floor 27 with computers to use there.Meetings can be held there or just to relax. Your phone can become a mobile door key with their app which also acts as a guide when in New York. There is free chilled, purified water on each floor in refillable bottles. Rooms have yoga mats. There is a fitness floor. The TV has all kinds of functions beyond watching programmes such as streaming to it. There is a cupboard on the landing near the rooms with more room items to self-refill if needed. These are clever touches that really added to my stay. The rooms for central NY are a decent size with helpful bathroom items, iron and board, seating/office area and bed, various lighting options and USB charing. I only had three very minor issues. First, a slightly loose electrical fitting (room 2109 near the door) and secondly, a crack in the sink. The other minor issue was the loud noise of the air conditioning but that was because it was highly effective. After a while it can just be turned off. But these were minor issues and did not impact on my stay at all. Looking out directly at the Empire State building in front of me kind of balanced it out. The shower was good, towels are plentiful. The bed and bedding were fine. I like their commitment to minimising washes, you can choose when they change the bed and towels.I'll be back. The place is great, the staff are friendly and chat when they see you. It's a feel good place. The staff cannot be more helpful and importantly, they seem happy and proud to work there. We had some laughs and the free wine@5 kept flowing.Explore floor 27, order some food, get free coffees and cold water all day, try the linked restaurant directly from the hotel. Have free snacks, free fruit, relax in the club room and the balcony. This is a different experience, more like being in an apartment block than a hotel. But then apartments don't have free coffee either!I've given a five star review. I'm not saying this is a perfect place, the lobby is small, there are tiny quibbles I mentioned. But you know what, I didn't care a jot. The experience here was great, the staff were helpful and the various features are a step beyond other places. I think of this more like managed apartments than a hotel, if you have everything you need such as socket adaptors and so on, you'll have a great experience. This is a different experience to an old style hotel. The Thai food I ordered directly from my laptop is on my way to the room, last night it was great crispy chicken from another place. You manage your own staff here. Somehow any minor quibbles go away when you can order food, get free refills and relax looking out at central New York.

This is my second time at CQ - Grand Central. Because I had such an amazing nights sleep there the first time, I also stayed at CQ Wall st and that delivered as well.It’s very unfussy but they get the important things right - really friendly, efficient staff with a good positive attitude. Rooms are clean and have what you need if you are mainly spending all your time outside your hotel room. Nice comfortable bed and tea/coffee etcWhat I like about it most is that despite its location the rooms I’ve had have been really quiet. I haven’t been woken by other guests or - amazing for NY - street noise.They also provide free water stations on every floor and the happy hour with free wine is a really nice idea if you’re at a loose end or working and can get out the room. Will be back! Ticks the boxes that matter.

Be warned! This hotel will misuse your credit card! Have charged my credit card 2000 $ plus without documentation and my signature. Very upsetting since the rooms were prepaid by my travel agency. Make sure that you don't let the hotel make a print of your credit card and get receipt of all your purchases!

This CQ hit all the marks. Really large room (no fridge or microwave though) that was kept very clean. Easy check in/out process; love the refill water stations (though they are a touch slow to fill); clean gym with all the equipment you'd need. Terrific stay. The location is amazing, close to any train you'd need.

Stayed a number of times but never realized the hotel has a 27th story deck with a great view. 20 minute walk to almost all Broadway venues. You can enjoy Manhattan but are never far from your bed. What’s not to like?

I would definitely stay here again! I was on a 5 day vacation with my two adult daughters. We had two rooms. They shared one which was a bit tight but they managed just fine. Highlights: The staff, most 3 of 5 we saw, we're very friendly and helpful. The 27th Floor - lovely lounge area with "free" snacks and coffee etc. 3 Elevators that worked well - although the swiping of the card reader to chose your floor was tricky. You had to swipe several times before the button would "take". Wifi was good, room was clean and in good condition. Shower pressure good. Lots of room in bathroom for toiletries. Very compact but very well laid out. My only real compliant is the noise from the AC unit - VERY LOUD. You know when it drowns out NYC traffic it has to really be something! But overall a very pleasant experience.

I was in the city for a work training and this hotel put my exactly 2 blocks from my training building. The location of the hotel is wonderful, as you are close to restaurants, Bryant Park, Grand Central, Times Square, etc. My room was clean and well kept - no complaints there! I did have some trouble with my room key not working in the elevator, so I brought it to the staff and they easily solved the issue within minutes. I also had trouble one evening getting into my room with my key. After going down to the desk twice, they figured that the battery on my door had died and told me that somebody would come to fix it the next day. They worked very quickly to get me into my room and were apologetic, which I appreciated. Finally, the deadbolt on my door did not work. I'm sure had I said something to the staff they would have done something about it, but I didn't bother. Overall, the staff was friendly and helpful, the room and hotel in general is very clean, and the location is ideal (if you want or need to be in Midtown).

Perfect hotel close to Grand Central Station. Superior service and good value.Free wine from 5:00 to 6:00 PM with very nice hosts.Free coffee and soft drinks the whole day.Terasse at 27th floor is amazing to take pictures of Chrysler Building and others.We will come back!

Midtown location. The entrance from the street (I hesitate to call it a lobby) was tiny as was the room. I paid for a room that was pictured with a small table and bench seating, but there was no table and only one chair. The room did not even have a luggage rack, nor was there space for one. For the two days my wife and I were there, we had to deal with having our suitcase on the floor. However, the room seemed reasonably tidy and the location worked for us as it was a block from Grand Central. Not sure if I’d return.

We are staying here for a week. Great location. Jonny put us up on the 25th floor away from the noise. Excellent!! Elizabeth is an absolute asset to club quarters she was attentive, knowledgeable and so helpful. Would recommend this hotel. Comfy beds and helpful staff

It was our first time staying in a New York hotel and was bit nervous about what to expect. Our stay was more than comfortable! The room was small, but definitely not as small as I had expected. The bed was very comfortable and shower pressure was great! Great location. The staff was extremely friendly! We will be staying here every time we visit our daughter!

Fantastic hotel! The first requirements I have when booking a hotel is location, cleanliness and security. QCGC aced all of these and more!From the moment we arrived (noon) we were greeted by professional, friendly staff who did everything in their control to accommodate any request. Our room was not ready so they checked our luggage (at no charge) and invited us to the 27th floor. Our return flight was a late evening flight again we checked our luggage and headed out to enjoy our last day in NYC. Upon arrival to retrieve our luggage we again where invited to the 27th floor to relax. Thanks to Greg that was a perfect way to end our trip.The location is perfect midtown east a few minutes walk to lots of attractions. The hotel is extremely clean. The elevator requires your room key to access the floors. The rooms are what is to be expected in NYC as far a size but well laid out. The bed was comfortable, linens and towels were great shower was hot. Did not use safety deposit on the 2nd floor but they were available, The water stations on each floor a nice added touch.There is a gym and laundry facility as well and all free. The 27th floor is a great place to chill after a full day of tours and the snacks and beverages are yet another added bonus.The real perk here is the staff. Front desk, housekeeping and maintenance staff always had a smile and were friendly and welcoming. The team constantly stated how friendly we Canadians are (even if the Raptors were kicking butt) but they rank right up there. This is my hotel for my next trip to NYC hands down. Thank you to all the staff!!

This is a very convenient hotel near Grand Central Station. The rooms are clean and the staff reasonable and helpful. The breakfast drinks, snacks and happy hour is a nice addition.There are several restaurants close by and transport at Grand Central is wonderful. I would stay there again.

Picked CQ as an alternative to our usual stay (Grand Hyatt, 5mins away), based on positive reviews. Knew was going to be smaller so wasn’t quite sure what to expect. Surprised initially at the reception and the room (reminded me a bit of Premier Inn back home). Once in and settled though, checked out the club living room and that was it. Completely won over. Staff are a credit and deserve all their plaudits. Had a room on 20th floor to get away from street level noise as far as possible in NYC. Resort fee is reasonable in comparison to other hotels. The whole club room thing with wine and snacks is a winner and well worth a visit if you want to chill and re charge. Safety deposit boxes are in a strong room on second floor, which are a twin key arrangement (you and staff member), which seemed a bit inconvenient as apposed to room safes, but soon planned around this. We had a standard room rather than club room, which I believe were smaller, so would avoid if possible as a leisure traveller. Caught a few residents looking to change rooms at times in reception, which the staff seemed to be trying to accommodate. Reminded me of Premier Inn a touch back home at first. Can’t really add much more than the other positive reviews of this CQ hotel, with the staff being a credit to it (unfair to single anyone out, but I’m still not your type Chris ). Really pleased we chose this over our usual. Would recommend and would definitely return, assuming the high standard of staffing is retained.

First of all, when I booked this hotel the name was Hotel Boutique at Grand Central, didn’t mention it was Club Quarters. And as you can see, I’ve received an email from Club Quarters to rate the hotel. I’ve felt completely cheated because I had read bad reviews about Club Quarters and didn’t want to stay there, so it was a big surprise when I got to the address and there was only a sign saying it was Club Quarters, it was past 10pm and I had to enter and ask the recepcionist if the hotel was Hotel Boutique at Grand Central. About the hotel: I had asked for fridge and microwave, there wasn’t any at the room. The room is very tiny, you can’t even open 2 bags and walk through the room. The bed is queen size (little), I was told they don’t have king size beds. When I got to my room, the USB charger didn’t work, so I’ve called front desk asking if they had an adapter because I’m from Brazil and the outlet is different, they told me they didn’t have and I had to buy one (it was past 11pm). The bathroom is walk in shower but it’s fabric curtain, I don’t like it, and it didn’t show that on the pictures. I had booked for 3 nights but after all the problems we’ve decided to change hotels, so I asked for a refund for the last night, we stayed only 2 nights and I explained all the problems I had and that I thought it was a different hotel but indeed it was Club Quarters, even though, they charged me anyway for the 3 nights. It looks like they’ve been receiving bad reviews under the name of Club Quarters, so they’ve decided to use another name (Hotel Boutique at Grand Central) to improve their rating and mislead the customers. When I left, I asked them to hold my luggage for a couple of hours, when I returned to retrieve my luggage, it took a long time to find out where they were because the recepcionist didn’t even know that the hotel has another room upstairs to storage luggage. They say they receive packages for free, but I would advice that it doesn’t feel trustable, they doesn’t look organized and the reception area is very little. Only good point was the wine at afternoon and bottle of water for free.

Elizabeth went over and beyond the call of duty to make my day as comfortable as can be. Her radiant smile projected such positivity daily it made setting off into the New York streets with a more vibrant energy. She’s so warm and personable. She’s so charming to converse with. Highly recommended stay

The hotel is located in Midtown Manhattan, very close to the Grand Central Station and close to the city's tourist attractions. A high level boutique hotel. Express check-in. Very spacious and clean rooms. The great advantage of the hotel is undoubtedly the rooftop floor with views of New York City. In addition to the rooftop floor, guests are treated with treats such as healthy snacks and good coffee. Every day at 5 pm, until 6 PM, the hour of wine, Chris welcomes the guests with a big smile and generously pours wine, and on the roof floor there is a computer station and internet for use by the hotel guests.  Each floor has a stand for filling water bottles. The hotel meets the needs of travelers in New York. We were very pleased and definitely recommend the hotel. And hope to be there again. Thanks to all the hotel staff.

I came to the Club Quarters hotel for a Board of Directors meeting for 10 days. On the first day coming our whole group knew it was a great, the staff was immediately welcoming and accommodating to our large group, and worked to ensure that we had a great experience. The have a guest services manager named Chris who welcomed all of us by name, lead trivia games in their terrace and lounge, gave great recommendations for food and activities in the city, and continued to check in and do everything that was needed. Overall, a great place to stay. I definitely would come back. The picture is a view from the lounge on the top floor!

Loved the hotel. Dropped our son off for an summer internship and my husband and I stayed to explore NY for a day. The location was perfect for access to what we needed. The staff was extremely friendly. Loved the rooftop terrace and snacks and wine at 5. Room and bathroom were very clean and big enough for us, we just needed a place to sleep. Bed was fairly comfortable. Only negative was loud ac unit but that seems to be just the way it is with hotel ac units, it wasn't enough of an issue to warrant mentioning it to the staff. Would definitely recommend and would certainly stay again.

Such a great hotel! It was clean, very nice, and the staff was super friendly. Elizabeth is amazing and was so sweet our entire trip! The rooftop lounge and outside area is also such a great place to hang out and enjoy the view. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Free wine 5pm-6pm every day. I arrived / checked in around 6:05pm and asked about the wine. Receptionist explained that they were closing up the wine but said to come back down in 15 minutes because he was having a bottle brought down for me.This is my second stay here (over a week total) and I've had two different rooms. Both rooms had everything I needed, were clean, and felt very comfortable.

We really enjoyed our stay here, it was a great location for getting around to see all of the main sights. Rooms were on the smaller side but were clean and had everything we needed. All of the staff that we dealt with were really friendly and helpful. Also, having the living area with coffee machine and rooftop was a great space to sit after a day of sightseeing. One thing we didn’t like was that the room windows opened completely with no safety catch at all to restrict this, we were staying on the 24th floor so found this uneasy. We just kept the window closed, however we would expect this to be locked/restricted in some way.

We enjoy the room size and top floor amenities room with coffee and wine. The coffee machine should be moved since it is in a corner and located in such a way that lines form as people try to do their coffee.

The location is great and the facilities - the terrace on 27th floor with snacks and coffee, laundry room - were excellent.However, two things bothered me: 1. The night shift guy that I interacted with ast the first night was rude, cold and not at all inclined to please or help. coming in tired after a long ride it wasn't a nice feeling talking to him.2. I booked a wheelchair accessible room and got a tiny room, almost impossible to maneuver and get around. I went down and asked whether there are other, bigger rooms (specifically asked about the 2nd floor) and the rude guy from above told me they are not ADA accessible. I went to sleep with a bad feeling and in the morning asked the clerk about bigger rooms and sure enough - there were two rooms on 2nd floor which were bigger and more suitable. I was transferred to that room and they didn't charge extra.All in all it's a good and clean hotel, but if you are a wheelchair user you need a a superior room (2nd floor). Also, the superior room was not perfectly accessible: the sink has a big peace of metal underneath that does not enable full access. The folding shower chair is located on the wrong wall so for someone who needs to sit on it it will be difficult to reach the shower handle and the water.

Hotel is central. Nicely appointed rooms with everything you need. Not a bad size for NY hotelroom. We enjoyed the free cuppaccino on the top floor of the hotel. The free water on every floor also came in handy.Snackbars and fruit in the morning was a nice to get.

We really appreciated our 3 night stay in Club Quarters. Staff are helpful and very positive minded. We felt comfortable the minute we got in. Do not miss the view from the 27th floor with a glass of "happy hour" wine.

What a fabulous d this was.From Rey at front desk to Chris who seemed to e everywhere.Fabulous roof deck.Rooms big enough and spotless.The vibe was a well run hotel with many returnees.Ihope to be one of these.

Wow what a great hotel this is! The central location, cleanliness, amenities and rooftop terrace already make this a really good hotel. However, on top of all that is the sensational service. Especially Tré, he truly did everything he could to make our stay even better. We are truly appreciative! Thanks CQ and thank you Tré!!

This is a good option for mid-town -- modern and updated. Not a lot of personality in the lobby. As a security feature, you need your room card to use the elevator. The rooms are not huge but for the price it's fine. There is a free wine mixer every night. There is another Club Quarters on the same street, two blocks away (Times Square), and apparently people frequently show up at the wrong one. So be sure to double-check the address!

Very helpful and efficient staff, the rooftop happy hour was very welcoming, and a great way to interact with international and fellow travelers. The staff, particularly Chris, really went the extra mile. Rooms were great, I always felt safe

Enjoyed a 4 day stay in NYC... Our Club Quarters room, while compact, was very clean. Loved the bottled water dispensers and the snacks.. the only issue, and on a hot weekend s major issue, was the air conditioner only worked for a few minutes, and would shut down and just recirculate the hot air. Reported the issue after first night, wasn’t addressed. Had to prop door open to get relief..

This is a great place to stay. Elizabeth in the rooftop lobby was a sweetheart. She recommended a place for dinner, chatted with us for awhile and even took a photo for us. The room was much larger than the other hotel we stayed at a few nights before and the yoga mat was a cool addition.

This was my second time i stayed at the club quarters grand central. I arrived early in the morning even though the check in was 3:00. David Scott check if my room is available, there is a room in a high floor and early check in was $50. I don't mind paying $50 as long as I get the room, especially a high floor room. Also David recommend a good place for breakfast close by, it's called the comfort diner.

Had an excellent stay here. Chris (the hotel influencer) was so welcoming and engaging. He genuinely cares about you and your wellbeing. He knows everyone and they know him! They also serve complimentary wine and snacks. Highly recommend this hotel!

Modern decor and convenient location by Grand Central unfortunately did not quite make up for the messy check in. With no lobby to speak of , when there were issues with guest checking in or checking out, the bottleneck at the single service counter turned into a long wait. Then they could not find my reservation. When they apparently did, they kept saying I was already checked in, which should have set off alarm bells. They sent me to a room that had been occupied, with bed slept in and with other guests' luggage. When I came back down to the lobby, their look was that of a deer in the headlight, and took them a while to figure out what had happened. What a mess. If you get a room here, you need to be careful about someone else having access to your valuables in your room.

In the last two years I am staying at the hotel every month for one week (business trips). The hotel is a great value for money: clean, comfortable with lovely 27th floor launch, Gym and free laundry room. The main asset of the hotel, however, is its great team. Front desk, cleaning and maintenance all are very friendly, welcoming, efficient and professional – making you feel like home.I am delighted to specifically mention (and sorry for the ones I have not) Sandy, Ray and the front desk team that would do their utmost to make you feel welcome. Wilkins, Antonio and Yocasta and other team members that made the hotel looks at its best. And Elizabeth that is the heart of the hotel, best customer service one can have, always happy to assist, gladly responsive to any request making you feel like the most welcome gust (hope the hotel will know how the keep and develop this most valuable talents going forward).

Understaffed, and non attentive to customer requests. TV and air conditioning was not working. No one would answer the phone. I called for an hour straight just to get pillows for my children. Never again!

The staff at the hotel were very helpful and gave great suggestions about the surrounding area. I had terrific interactions with all of the staff but especially Wilkin, Kevin and Elizabeth. The hotel is clean and in a great location. The rooms are not huge but then you have the lounge that you can go to at any time, plus it has a nice balcony.

Spent three nights here on a trip with my mom. We shared a queen room, which was pretty small but efficiently used the available space. Great shower, A/C worked great, and free wine happy hour with Chris from 5-6 on the terrace! The water stations were also a nice amenity. Easy access to Grand Central. If you visit, be sure to hit up Spa45 across the street for a 1 hr reflexology massage! Can’t see any reason why’d id stay elsewhere on my next visit. We booked through HotelTonight and the rate was very reasonable.

Great location, staff friendly and helpful, Chicago had slightly bigger room, and bigger coffee serves, otherwise no problem.Not far from Times Square, even closer to Grand Central Terminal and easy bus trip from Penn Station, or MTA.

I recently travelled to New York and stayed at this hotel for work and then pleasure. When I holiday I usually select reasonably priced locations with breakfast. However since I didn't want to waste a day changing hotels, I stayed on. This is a detailed review as I feel it is quite expensive for a tourist who spends the day out and only needs breakfast, a shower and a bed for the night.The carpeted room is a good size (for a single person), furnished with a large bed (queen I think - a bit too soft for my liking and the pillows were a bit lumpy), a chaise longue with a reading light, upholstered chair, matching headboard, pedestals, a table, flat screen TV, a full length mirror, wall mounted coat rack and a wardrobe. There is also a radio with a USB port to charge your phone which was a relief as I did not purchase a US plug. The duvet cover is made from a slippery material, so if you use the blanket from the wardrobe underneath, the duvet slips off. I found the air conditioning unit a bit strange, it would heat up the room and when it overshot the temperature, it would cool the room. The light switches are conveniently located at the door and below a pleasant reading lamp attached to the headboard.The cleaning staff keep the room so immaculate, I almost forgot to wear my shower shoes! You can leave a card on the bed so that you can help conserve water by not having your beddings changed. I bring this up for the reason below.The bathroom is also a good size for a single person, large mirror and a wall mounted magnifying cosmetic mirror. The shower itself is stupid, you have to turn to cold water to turn the tap off, so when you're lathered up, cold water shoots out and you waste water as you adjust to find your comfortable temperature again. So I kept the tap running for my shower instead of constantly fiddling with it. There is a hair dryer provided.There is a capsule coffee machine and coffee and tea in the room but no kettle to boil water for tea. You have to go up to the 27th floor for hot water. This bugged me as I drink 2 glasses of warm water after brushing my teeth. There is chilled water with water bottles available on every floor.There is a gym and washing machines available for guests to use on one of the floors but I didn't use (I'm not doing washing while there's places to go!).The living room on the 27th flooris relaxing and you can enjoy your morning coffee while admiring the Chrysler building. It has a flat screen TV, four PCs and free internet (WiFi is free and available throughout the hotel). Breakfast beverages are available all day but there's no breakfast. In the morning energy bars and fruit are available but the station is unmanned. For two straight days, I arrived only to leave for the elevator waiting area to ring reception to send someone up to empty the grounds out of the complicated coffee machine as the other guests couldn't be bothered. In fact, another guest felt it was more productive to beat the machine than call reception.Later in the day, the station is manned by fabulous hosts. Wasabi peas, salted peanuts sunflower seeds, pretzels, chips and my new best friend, a huge bottle of m and m's are available as well as a glass of wine at five.The staff at the hotel from the receptionists Ashley, a thin, short young man and a tall gentleman (I didn't get their names, sorry!), to the handyman and living room hosts, Elizabeth and Chris, are utterly delightful and want to be at your service.Ordinarily as a tourist, I would rate this type of hotel three stars because there's no breakfast and not having my own kettle was inconvenient but a cellphone charger in the room, free WiFi with excellent reception (which I needed thanks to MTN's crazy roaming charges), four PCs, a printer and exceptional staff tack on one more star.I think, in terms of value for money, this hotel is best suited to people who are looking to escape the hustle and bustle and value their privacy.

Excellent service from the front desk. Hotel *PROVIDES* amenities free-of-charge (filtered water, personal laundry, etc.) without looking to nickel and dime their patrons. Perfect for the individual business traveler.

Excellent location right by Grand Central. Close to Times Square and theaters. Room was good sized. Liked lounge on 27th floor for coffee and fruit in the morning. Wine in the afternoon was a good amenity if you're back by 5:00.

As stated before, this hotel is a gem! The staff is always attentive to your needs and any requests presented to them. The room, clean and always comfortable. A total joy to stay here whenever I'm in town for business. Centrally located for my needs but also for easy maneuvering in midtown. This time I worked with Trey and he was amazing! Very informative and extremely welcoming. A huge thanks!

Horrible experience. Never had a good nights rest. First room was dirty and had a terrible smell, second room wasn’t much better. Only positive comment was the lounge and the free wine every night which still didn’t compensate for the terrible room

Fantastic location beside Grand Central, easy walking distance to #6 subway line. Small lobby area, but friendly staff. Rooms are small, but very well laid out, clean, and nicely decorated. Rooftop lounge is very nice spot in the morning and late afternoon. Overall, great experience and solid value!

Great location, staff, facilities, everything! All were very helpfull. Room was also great, clean and comfty. They kept our luggage in storage with no cost and they also receive Amazon packages for free.

Great location, well-fitted rooms with coffee, fridge, etc. The 27th Floor is always stocked up with goodies too, which is a huge bonus. Happy Hour with Chris has to be the highlight of staying at this hotel. Great fun having drinks, unwinding, meeting new people.

Staff were extremely efficient, helpful& friendly, especially Elizabeth and Wilkim. Room very comfortable, and roof lounge is great. We have really enjoyed our stay, and would recommend you without hesitation.

You can't beat the location of this hotel in midtown and the sheer and awesome friendliness of the welcoming staff who will bend over backwards to help you with anything to help you have a most delightful stay. My room on the 17th floor is awesome with a very comfortable bed and view of the New York City skyline. There are snacks, beverages and coffee available 24 hours on the 27th floor.All in all, I couldn't be happier with my choice of Club Quarters Grand Central. You will not find a better value and friendlier staff anywhere. Kudos to Ashley, Chris, Ben, Elizabeth and Antonio for going out of their way to give me a fantastic and most pleasant week in New York City after not being there for over twenty years.

This is a very clean hotel, w/nice rooms and great amenities. The rooms are small, but in NYC I wouldn't expect anything else! It was less than a 5 minute walk from our offices in Midtown, Grand Central Station and tons of food/entertainment, I will stay here again for sure!

Just had another GREAT stay at the Club Quarters Grand Central! I have used this hotel many times before, and the staff is always so friendly and helpful. Don't worry about room sizes, you are in NEW YORK CITY folks. Get out and explore! Then head up to the 27th floor lounge, where they have FREE help yourself snacks, fresh fruit, soda, and coffee available all day long. In the morning they offer coffee, fresh fruit, and granola bars. Also in the lounge, every day between 5 and 6 PM, they have a FREE Happy Hour (unheard of in NYC), offering several different wines, bagged snacks, and cookies. Grab a glass of wine (or soda or coffee), and walk out onto the open air terrace, to take in some great views of the City. A special shout out goes to Chris who does a really AWESOME job of hosting the Happy Hour and putting on games of trivia. He really engages the guests, and makes everyone feel welcome, relaxed, and at home. He is truly one of a kind! If you see him, tell him Mike says Hi! Antonio and Liz do a fantastic job assisting Chris with the Happy Hour. Rey, Jillian, and Sandy at the front desk are always so friendly and pleasant that you almost feel like they are welcoming you into their own homes. Lastly, a very special shout out goes to Ashley. She was so friendly and sincere that although she was not there very long, it felt like I knew her for years. Good Luck Ashley, you will truly be missed!

Recent week stay in NYC. Limited NYC experience (one previous visit) but liked the Club Quarters Grand Central, especially for the location. Easy walk to theatre district, great access to Grand Central Station and subway lines. Very friendly staff and full of suggestions on must see plays and how to access tickets for less expense. Very nice 27th floor common area for quests and great 5:00pm wine social.

Have stayed here twice in last few months. Although small, Club Quarters provides everything you need for a very reasonable price. Clean environment, friendly/helpful staff responsive to any special requests, etc. Although rooms are small, they have everything one needs and beds are comfortable. I haven't yet had time to visit the 27th floor for the happy hour -- perhaps during the next trip. Very much recommended.

Was in NYC on business, and this hotel was perfect. It is convenient to our office, a great value, and the staff is SUPER friendly. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and there is also a great happy hour. Shout out to Chris for making it fun!

Coming from upstate NY the Club Quarters is a quick walk from Grand Central. Usually a room is under $200 per night and a rarity for NYC. Nice free amenities such as bottled water available on each floor, 24 hour coffee and the 5 pm wine hour daily.

Pleasant place and make you feel at home. Reservations were efficient and timely A better breakfast will help. Staff at hotel were friendly and willing to help The location was ideal for me, and club lounge was a great place to chill

Although I was in New York for 3 days, I enjoyed my stay at the Club Quarters Hotel. I found staff to be efficient, polite and helpful. The location is great and was very happy with my room, which was super clean. The lounge on 27th Floor is also very useful for meetings etc. Will definitely stay next time am in NY.

I had never tried a Club Quarters Hotel before, and I came away with a very favorable impression. The room design is well-suited to a business traveler: clean, pleasant, with a place to work. But I was in New York on business -- not to see the sights or to lounge around in the room. Paying only for what I needed for a business trip in an environment that felt very new (not at all beat up) was right on target. I would stay there again in a heartbeat the next time I am in New York.

Quality of room and food very good Recommended for all.Friends,family as well as individuals all should enjoy their stay here.Your employee particularly CHRIS was very very gentle and forthcoming to all the guests

Do not stay at this location. I spent two nights and ended up with over 100 bed bug bites. Bright the critters home with me! Contacted management and was told that an inspection came back negative and that they were not able to do anything.

Great location, very helpful and friendly staff, rooms are adequate - not too big and not too small. Very clean, efficient and met my needs as a business traveler. The rooftop lounge was a definite plus with coffee, tea and snacks in the a.m. and a lively happy hour with free wine from 5-6pm. No room service - but you're in NY - and can have anything delivered to the lobby or go explore! Only item that didn't go so smooth was the keyless entry on the phone - it's hit or miss at best - so just get the key card and avoid the aggravation.

The hotel in general it awesome, great services, snacks included if you are hungry in the morning, internet was great, and the bed was great! the bathroom was a big enough and modern, the only concern is if you want to have another child in the bedroom rhe sofa is very small an has to be take in consideration.... I higly recommend the hotel and probably will book there again..

minibar would be appriciated, service and reception ok. From the hotel it is easily to walk uptown and downtown.The grand Central is 2 minutes away.The italian restaurant of the hotel can be recommandedAssistance was Always avalible.Will come back to your hotel next time

My room, 1202 corner room, was very clean and comfortable. The small kitchen unit had a nice coffee machine, fridge, microwave and utensils. Bed was very comfortable. Used the laundry machines and they were excellent. Did not really use the 27th floor for refreshments but great views of surrounding area. My only complaint was, but nothing that the hotel could do about is, that the renovation works at Bath & Body Works was extremely noisy during the night. The huge truck stationed on Lexington was grinding all the building materials and it made a hell of a racket. Two nights in a row until 3:30 am! Not a lot of sleep on those nights. Beside this, all the staff were very friendly and accommodating and I will definitely return.

Comfy bed, spacious bathroom, great location...friendly staff ... loved the free coffee and wine.. but actually it’s not really free cuz you pay a resort fee. Fast quick elevators. Loacation I liked .... near grand central although most of the cafes at night were close... if you like eating in nice cafes go to Columbus ave around 60th street up.

Good location is the main point of the hotel, personel, accommodation on very high level. Free snack's bar - wine, fruits, chips between 5 pm - 6 pm was a great surprise.I strongly recommend for everyone who want to visit the New York City.

Very good location in NYC, great point for my meetings , all key buildings in reach, and very friendly atmosphere, staff very friendly, 27th floor is a good concept, happy to come back on my next relevant buissness trip

Wonderful location and generous staff. They made sure my daughter and I had everything we needed for a fun NYC weekend of sightseeing and theater. And we had a great view of the city skyline from the rooftop lounge..

We loved this hotel. It was well positioned for transport around Manhattan and to and from the airport. The room was very clean and of adequate size for two people for our 6 night stay. ALL staff were great, very helpful and happy. We particularly enjoyed the wine at 5pm hour, as we met and talked with lovely people from around the world. Chris, Elizabeth, Julio and Kevin were outstanding. Chris was a marvellous host and involved everyone in the room! We will definitely return and would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Fantastic location and great hotel, with helpful staff and speedy check in/ check out. Rooms are not overly big (but that is New York), but have exactly what you need for a trip to New York: a comfy clean bed, nice clean bathroom, a nice seating area and all the plugs and hooks in the right places. Grand Central Station is only a two minute walk away (more or less across the street) and even Rockefeller and Times Square are in easy walking distance. Also, 5 o'clock is happy hour on the 27th floor with some free wine and nibbles, with a view on the Chrysler building. Don't miss it.

I love Club Quarters! The rooms are modern and clean; the bed is comfy and the tech accommodations are great. The front desk staff was helpful in arranging a car to the airport for me. I love the free happy hour and the constant access to coffee and tea in the lovely space on the top floor, which has nice common space and views. Would be nice to have some hard boiled eggs up there in the morning. The fruit and granola bars are nice but tough for those of us watching our carbs. ;) Also: location! All of my meetings were in Midtown and you just can’t beat the centrality of this hotel. Cheers to Club Quarters!

Stay here. Not inexpensive, but worth it. Very nice people, wonderful location, and a more than comfortable room. New York small, but not tiny. I thoroughly enjoyed my interactions with everyone there, and if you are silly enough to bring in a car (like I was), they have a great rate at a local garage.

We've stayed here many times. The staff is so friendly and so are the guests. People even talk to each other in the elevators. The guests are very international. Rooms are small but efficiently arranged to utilize the limited space. We love the upstairs 'living room' with a great view and snacks all day. Great to relax between business and sight seeing. And Chris is a wonderful 'host' and staff member.

New building, meticulously maintained. Extremely personable staff always helpful. Had a shower head start leaking and they had it fixed within a half hour. The 27th floor lounge is always open. Free snack, fresh fruit and great fresh-brewed coffee.

This hotel is part of a chain and there are others a bit more central. That's not to say that this hotel is out of the way but it is worth bearing in mind if you have restricted movement. The hotel is clean and the rooms are a reasonable size. Plenty of hot water in the bathroom and the brilliant water cooler on the landing with re-usable bottles you can fill as many times as you want.

It was amazing to stay here! Chris, Kevin, Sacha and Ashley make us feel like a family. The facilities are clean, modern and with a variety of amenities. At 27th floor they serve as a complimentary gift wine, snacks and soda! I recommend this hotel 100%.

review_body: Great location: 5-10mins walk to Times Square and 5mins walk to Grand Central. Our room was nice, a decent size, very quiet even though it was right on Lexington Avenue, and was cleaned daily with fresh bedding and towels. Staff were very friendly and welcoming and more than happy to provide information on places to see, eat and drink. The rooftop living room on the 27th floor is a nice touch with seating, tables and most notably, a great view of NYC! Unfortunately the terrace still had it's winter cover on when we visited (April) but but we were told it's open-air in the summer. We got take out and Magnolia bakery cheesecake and ate dinner up there a couple of nights - much better views than in any local restaurant! The hotel provides complimentary soft drinks and snacks til 8pm - after that time the only option is a vending machine. Tea and coffee is available 24/7. Complimentary wine is available daily 5-6pm with hosts Chris and Paul who were very welcoming and created a good atmosphere.

The people that work in the hotel made the experience really good.The location is perfect to move around subway in Grand Central.Excellent amenities, impecable cleaning, very nice people on the reception except for Johnny, bad attitude.

Up in NYC for a business trip. Hotel was nice and Terrence at the front desk lent me a tie for a meeting (I forgot to pack mine). I will stay at this hotel again next time I am in the area. Abracadabra

The hotel is clean and ideally situated to get around New York easily. Staff are very friendly and attentive. There is free coffee and tea available 24 hrs. Free snacks available through the day and free wine between 17.00 and 18.00. Chris who did the wine@5 is brilliant and so helpful. New York is so busy and manic but we loved it. If I were to return I wouldn’t hesitate in coming back to this hotel. I’ve already recommended it to some friends. My only criticism is my daughter/granddaughters room didn’t have any drawers and only a small wardrobe so they had suitcases on the floor with their clothes in but our room had drawers in the wardrobe so we were fine. I also received the check out bill which were taxes that are stated on booking.com when I booked. Didn’t realise how much theses were going to be. $108 per room so this added another £170/180 to our room rate. Just be mindful of this when booking through hotel websites. It still may be the case if you book detect with the hotel. Also prices you see in most shops are minus the tax so beware. If you don’t do anything else while your there go to Stardust diner in Times Square. You’ll have to queue but it will be worth it. Check it out online!

Two employees get honourable mentioned here, Chris and Johnny were both wonderful and made our week long stay that much better. If I knew all the employee names I would mention them all. From the front desk to housekeeping, all help their guest have a wonderful experience. The restaurant Davios is below ground and associated with the hotel. We had lunch and dinner there. We experienced exceptional service and the food was absolutely delicious. The chef was very accommodating to my special dietary needs and restricted portion. We absolutely love this hotel and restaurant! You can not go wrong staying and eating at this place!

We just returned from an overnight stay at CQ Grand Central. We arrived before check-in time so we needed to leave our luggage with the hotel staff before venturing out.Unfortunately we had a little mishap with a bottle of wine that broke in one of our bags. Sandy (who we left our luggage with) immediately claimed it as her fault and went above and beyond trying to remedy the situation. She came up to our room and proceeded to look over the damage, taking pictures of everything that was affected. She offered to take all of the items with her to clean. They were returned in excellent condition within a few hours. Our room smelled a bit from this spill, so Sandy immediately got us another one. A little later on in the afternoon Chris, (the Guest Relations Manager, who is hysterical and delightful, by the way) came to our room with a bottle of wine and a nut and fruit snack. When we checked out they offered us a free night’s stay in any of their hotels.  I have never received such caring attention from hotel personnel before, and we travel a lot! We would have never known how excellent and confident the staff was here if something like this hadn’t happened. Thanks again to the hotel staff, and especially Sandy, for all of the help and attention we received!

I stayed at the Midtown east Club Quarters for two nights on business this week. The staff was friendly, the room clean and well laid out, and overall it was a good stay. The rooms are very small but well equipped, and the windows good enough to keep out most NY traffic noise (other than sirens). I particularly appreciated the thoughtfully laid out bathroom that managed to provide adequate surfaces to place things, very good lighting, and a well placed mirror. Sadly, it had no ventilation (I finally figured out that the fan was broken, too late to have it fixed for my stay), which meant that the bathroom smelled strongly of bleach from the hotel's cleaning products my entire stay. The second night I discovered how thin the walls were when a small child moved into the room next door. I couldn't hear its parents, but its toddler voice just poured through (of course, toddler voices have that ability). My only other beef is with the dismal coffee set up in the hotel "living room." There was one automatic espresso/coffee machine, which meant a very long line in the morning and then it was just bad. I discovered why when I saw a staff member refilling the milk reservoir with skim milk - blech!!! Luckily there was a Starbucks and other coffee choices within two blocks, but I do think an approach to coffee such as multiple carafes with different types of milk is a reasonable norm to follow in this day and age.

We had two rooms booked for our family of 5. A club double room and a superior room with kitchenette. The rooms were clean and comfortable, as said by others they are not big, but we found them to be fine. The superior room was ideal for 3, with a separated room from master bedroom with sofa bed and kitchenette with a fridge, microwave and coffee machine. It was a corner room with great views. The free supply of coffee, soft drinks and snacks all day is an added bonus, as is the wine happy hour! Nice chilled water and refillable water bottles was appreciated too. No safe in the room but there is a safe facility in the hotel which is accessed with staff support.The location is 5 minute walk from Grand central station, I was a little concerned before arrival that this was too far from central areas and wondered whether we should of booked nearer Times Square, but I honestly thought this gave the best location for us. It was only a 10-15 min walk to 5th Avenue and times square. We bought a subway metro pass for 7 days for $33, and used this to go from one end of Manhattan to another, it was our Best Buy of the trip!The dining hall within Grand Central was ideal for breakfast pastries and bagels.The hotel also has free use of pc’s and printers.I know someone has to be on the lower floors and this is no fault of the hotel... but they are noisy!Our daughters did manage to get moved to a higher floor as they found the noise from the air con units too much to bear! We were on the front on a lower floor so didn’t have this problem but did struggle to sleep with the constant noise from traffic, sirens and roadworks at 3am for 3 of our 5 nights here, ear plugs came in very useful!The staff were all friendly and helpful, and we would return.

Chris, Ann and Elizabeth were supper helpful and fun. Hotel was very clean. Price was average for the area. This was a great location for visiting many of the local popular sights in New York City. Very nice.

Simple clean room. But main thing for us was price and location and this ticked the boxes. 5 mins walk from grand central station and approx 15 mins walk to Times Square so great location if want to be in the mixer Had a small queen room which are small as you expect in new york but if just looking for somewhere to sleep which is clean, secure and on a budget it tickets the boxesOnly negatives - no security boxes in rooms (are available on request on another floor in hotel) and was overcharged on my credit card (so check your bill before leaving) - was refunded afterwards when I emailed booking.comOverall though a pleasant stay in a good location as a tourist. Would use again as couldn’t argue at price at New York standards

review_body: Great staff, nice sized room for NYC, great location, free snacks! I would definitely book a room at this hotel again. Grand Central is a couple of blocks away, easy to hop on the Subway. Lots of bars and restaurants to walk to.

The hotel was incredible and super helpful with everything we’ve asked. The rooftop view is the best! Shout out to Greg Grimes at the front desk for an incredible work and such a sweet and welcoming reception. He’s one of a kind! Thank you so much :)

(+) Small room, but with nice furniture (+) Good bathroom, large shower (I prefer not having to shower in a bath tub)(+) Silent Street(+) Great lounge area, free drinks all day(+++++) phenomenal happy hour concept with Chris in lounge area(+) efficient checkin and out

Not fancy but clean, convenient, and a few great perks! Happy hour daily, laundry for guests and friendly all around.Easy location to go anywhere. I walked and walked everything was available.Thanks Club Quarters

My first trip to NYC and not too sure what to expect from a city centre hotel, but have to say that I think that this hotel was very reasonable for what you get. Our greeting upon arrival was warm and friendly (as was all contact we had with the staff throughout our stay). The rooms are quite small (as are most NYC hotels), but it was well equipped with coffee machine, hairdryer, iron and ironing board. The room was clean and well presented, the bathroom the same. I felt that the room itself could have worked a bit bitter with more useful storage and a better layout - for example there was a small table with seating around which we never made use of and nowhere to store our empty suitcases. Both of these things could be easily resolved and would have made our stay a little more comfy. I guess it’s ok if you are only staying a couple of nights, but for any longer can become a little frustrating. The air conditioning was effective, the bed very comfy and for a city centre hotel I was surprised at how quiet it was and how well we slept! We didn’t hear any noise whatsoever from any of our neighbours. The gym is a great addition, and although we came with all great intentions, “holiday mode” took over and we did not use it, but the equipment there was great. The wine happy hour between 5-6pm daily was also a lovely touch. A nice place to go for a drink or two before heading out for the evening. Also great to have a little snack area for guests to help themselves to - small touches but great to have. The hotel is in a great location too, far enough away from lots of noise and people but only a short walk to Grand Central, Times Square etc so found it really easy to get around the city from there. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel, and wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again next time we’re back in New York.

First stay at Club Quarters and impressed by efficiency and friendliness as well as environmental consciousness. Nice to find recyclable bottles and free filtered water! - Crazy how so many hotels charge for bottled water!
