New York City, New York

review_body: The suite was large and comfortable. Also loved the free happy hour on the rooftop from 5-6! Great, friendly staff. Awesome location just adjacent to Grand Central Station. I loved that I could order room service from local restaurants, too - charged to the room.

I was there on a business trip, the hotel is walking distance to Grand Central Station. So, its central to all locations you'll need to travel to. Guest Services is great and helpful. It's a convenient location whether you want to grab a bit to eat, dine, shop, or even get a quick haircut in 15 to 20 minutes opposite the hotel before your business meeting. There's a yoga mat in the closet, water bottles outside the rooms, and a lounge area on 27th floor for snacks, tea and coffee

The staff was very serviceminded, we enjoyed the coffeemachine, fruit and the wineour on the topfloor. We also enjoyed having fresh water in bootles outside the elevator. All of this for a quit ok price.

Fantastic hotel in a great location. I was greeted by a very friendly gentleman named Chris who held the front door open for me and gave me a warm welcome. I was a frequent guest at the hotel in the past few years but have not been there in a year. Imagine my surprise when I got to the reception desk and saw Rey whom I had dealt with on many past visits. He gave me a huge smile and immediately said "Welcome back Mr. Pellegrino, we have missed you"! Talk about feeling special. Employees like Rey and Chris are tremendous assets and make a long day in rhe the road more pleasant with their welcoming attitudes.

My wife and I were spending a week visiting my step daughter and her husband who moved to NYC last Xmas. As they were living in Manhattan we decided a hotel close to them would be appropriate. We settled on this hotel on the basis it was not only close to them within a 15 minute walk but also close to all the major attractions.The room we had was on the small side which was to be expected but clean with good facilities. The only drawback which we did not complain about was that we were on the seventh floor at the back of the building. This was just about level with the air con mechanisms on top of the next door building. They were incredibly noisy and as there was a heatwave when we were staying were working overtime thus making even more noise. I know that the hotel would have moved us but we coped.The lounge area was really good with snacks and free wine and soft drinks available between 5pm and 6pm which opened out to a small open air terrace which gave you great views. The tea and coffee were available all the time. The lounge also had the IT facilities for guests.We hope to visiting my step daughter and her husband on a yearly basis whilst they are there and subject to getting a good price for the hotel we will not be looking elsewhere when we do.

We really enjoyed the club living room and found Elizabeth really friendly, welcoming and attentive. She was always there with a smile from the day we arrived. She went above and beyond to make me feel welcome and really added to my stay.

I came to visit my friend who was a guest at the hotel and on the Club Living Room and Elizabeth was immediately super warming and inviting! She was so attentive and kind. Turns out we are neighbors in Bushwick! Thank you Elizabeth for amazing hospitailty, conversation, and care!

Just returned from a terrific stay at Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central. From the minute we walked in the door until checkout the staff was friendly, accommodating and genuinely wanted us to enjoy our stay. The room was clean and well appointed, the Peloton bike in the gym was perfect and the hospitality/snack area was on point. We will definitely return.

This centrally located modern hotel boasts clean, comfortable rooms and a very friendly staff. The price is right and Davio's restaurant in the lower lobby is excellent. I will definitely plan to book here on my next visit to Manhattan.

Short Hills, New Jersey

review_body: The hotel was pricyworthy especially considering it's location. Enjoyed the rooftop bar, room was nice and have no complaints really. Also we had the pleasure to talk to Chris who made sure our visit was nothing but great!

We liked this hotel a lot. Great location near Grand Central Station. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable. One nice feature was the banquette seating in the room. The top floor indoor and outdoor space was a nice bonus. Every employee we encountered was friendly, including Zishan and Ray at the front desk. Ray, especially, would make it a point to talk to us and ask about our plans for the day. We would definitely stay here again.

We have been to NYC many times and this was our first at this Hotel. Six of us stayed from ages 5 to 69 years young we had an awesome stay in this hotel. Chris was Super at entertaining and informative during happy hour every night from 5-6 pm at the great rooftop area lounge area with a patio overlooking Manhattan on the 27th floor.Very Clean rooms… friendly staff… free water bottles, snacks, and fruit all day. We all agreed it’s a 5 star place. We will be staying here again!

Had a wonderful stay. Clean rooms friendly staff and great rooftop area. Have stayed at different locations, all are great, but the rooftop made this one special. Location great for transportation to La Guardia..Near Grand Central..

Had an awesome stay in this hotel . Chris was fun and entertaining and informative during happy hour . David on the front desk was very cheerful and friendly . All staff from front desk to housekeeping were very friendly and helpful

I loved everything about my stay here. The location was perfect for catching the #7 train up to the US Open. The staff was cordial and helpful. The room was clean, functional, tastefully decorated, and cozy. I loved the charming little touches like the yoga mat in my room, endless ice water and recyclable bottles on every floor, the roof top "living room" complete with complimentary wine and snacks, the free use of washers and dryers...and many other amenities that reflect CQ's mission to make their guests happy and comfortable. This is my new favorite hotel!

Love this hotel - staff couldn't have been nicer and more helpful; beautifully-designed room; free happy hour in a beautiful lounge area with a patio overlooking Manhattan (and the wine was good with tasty happy hour snacks). The lounge area also serves as a great work space. Loved that there was a yoga mat in the room. Thank you!

Location is simply great, easy access and plenty of interesting touristic spots in relatively short walking distance. Also, several transportation options nearby. The hotel staff make the difference here. Unlike other impersonal hotels where you feel as an stranger, in Club Quarters hotel each single member from their staff makes sure you feel welcome and just like home from the very first time you cross their doors. They are fast and resolutive if you face any type of inconvenience. For sure you will enjoy having small talk with any of their members or also having the chance to interact with other guests during the happy our they offer in the 27th floor terrace, provided with free wine, soft drinks and snacks. It was certainly a good decision staying with them.

Club Quarters Hotel was very conveniently located next to Grand Central Terminal and a few blocks away from the UN Headquarters. The room was clean and had everything we could have needed. The best feature was the club which had coffee, snacks, and a roofdeck to relax with friends. We wish we had stayed longer. The staff were all very friendly and welcoming.

My congratulations to Cris and Sandy and all the staff for being so helpful, warm and efficient! They made our stay a very pleasant and enjoyable one! Nice free wine ay 5! Would Stay again in a forthcoming trip to NYC! Congratulations Cris and Sandy!

Originally booked an Air BnB but decided last minute to cancel and stay here, and it was well worth it. The room was fantastic, there was air conditioning, premium television channels, daily housekeeping and re-stocking of hotel amenities. The staff was also amazing. I wish we got to know everyone by name but unfortunately didn't get the chance. We did, however, have outstanding experiences with both David and Zishan constantly. Both very friendly, very accommodating and always looking to spark up a conversation.Would recommend this hotel to anyone, and if I ever return to NYC I know that I will 100% be staying here once again.Mohamed

Hotel's a brand new property, spotless room, nice location, less than 5 minutes to Grand Central Station. Unbeatable in terms of cost-benefit! Nice personnel, specially Zisham and Chris at the reception! These guys really make a difference! If staying in Midtown is a must and you want to save some bucks, look no further! :-)

Rio de Janeiro, RJ

review_body: First time visiting NYC and there were so many hotels options avaiblable. We chose CQ as it was reasonably priced and in a good location. It was a great experience from the moment we walked in the check in was quick and efficient (under 5 mins). We then loved the location and the staff were very helpful, the facilities were great with the terrace and communal area on the top floor great for relaxing. Great stay!

Needed somewhere in midtown/east midtown and didn’t want to spend too much. This was a good price, right where I needed to be! 3rd & 45th, right across from Grand Central. Lobby was small, but fulfilled its purpose. Checkin staff was awesome. Room was small but excellent (I expected small). Had a nice work area and a good bed. Very comfortable. 27th floor lounge was great. Wine and snacks and a very nice view. The gentleman who hosted the happy hour was great. Very personable. Lots of restaurants and eating choices. I was very happy with my choice. Will definitely stay here again!

Enjoyed the wine hour each day and looked forward to the hospitality of our host Chris. Always delightful and full if suggestions to visit. Rooftop room is perfect for morning coffee and computer emails

The attentiveness of the staff is excellent. From the front desk to the housekeeping staff everyone was wonderful! The housekeeping staff seemed to know when I was away from the property and always cleaned my room to perfection.

New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel was perfect for our stay! Walking distance to almost everything we wanted to do and if we couldn't walk, the subway was very close. The customer service was excellent! Would definitely stay here again!

We stayed at the CQ Hotel in New York City at their Grand Central location. Not only was it a great location but the staff was beyond helpful and friendly at all times. From small talk in the elevators to wine hour with Chris, it was nothing shy of impressive. Jeunesse was so sweet and helpful when we needed certain things in our room and even remembered that my mothers birthday was this week and presented her with a card. We were very pleased and will definitely be back! Their comfortable "living room" that provides snacks and drinks all day with a wicked view of Lexington Ave from the terrace is worth acknowledging as well!!

New York City, New York

review_body: Have stayed here three times when I come into the city. This last time I had a spacious room with a convertible couch. My daughter and i especially appreciated the wine and snacks on the 27th floor from 5-6!Also really appreciated David who not only helped me check out, but walked me to the corner to make sure I was heading in the right direction!

100% recommendation from me and my family. Where to start?Firstly great location, next to grand central station, restaurants and bars in and around hotel.For the price we paid compared to our last stay in a different hotel, the room was great value. Clean, good view, air con, great tv with Netflix. Descent size.Now the amazing stuff; firstly the staff were all amazing but especially Zishan who offered us a room upgrade if we weren’t happy (but we were), give me the best location to drop the question to the misses and a great restaurant to go to after, he was a big help to making our day special. Chris gave a great first impression of the hotel the second we walked through the door, was funny and made the little one feel special.The hotel kept on giving part of stopping at the hotel enabled us to use happy hour between 5-6 with free wine and cans of pop, other bar type snacks. Coffee all day, fresh water machines on each floor with bottles to re-fill. Saved us a lot of money.Secondly the roof top terrace had a great view and was clean but best part was u could take ur own food and drinks up there. Again saved us a lot of money rather than paying loads at roof top bars we could buy our own refreshments and enjoy the view in piece and quiet.The value for money is great and I would recommend anyone to this hotel. Yes there will be better hotels in New York but u would be paying stupid money, when you can get what we had for the price we paid I know what I’d choose. Keep up the good work.

Very nice stay at the Grand Central Club Quarters in Manhattan. A few downsides were elevator out of order (only two out of three working during entire stay) that made for longer waits and the fire alarm that went off at 3:30 a.m., but that was due to a system malfunction. Housekeeping good, although one day was somehow skipped.

Always good to stay at CQ in NY. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms always clean. Good locations. Great pillows and bed linens. Very simple and stress free which as a business traveler is what I like.

When we arrived in NYC we did get the impression it needed some work! The decor needs some updating. BUT the staff make this place one of the best places J have stayed, the reception staff and Chris the host!

The front desk was very helpful. The common areas on the second floor are excellent. Free wifi, snacks, and the bottled water is a great touch. My suit shirt got wrinkled on the flight--free ironing boards and irons on hand were a great touch.

Well positioned hotel close to all transport and places of interest. Great for the subway too. Empire State Building walkable. Radio City and Times Square all within easy reach. Lovely staff and Happy Hour

For the location and the price the CQ works very well. it is right next to Grand central Station and is an easy walk to many of NYCs attractions.The rooms are designed very well, space is wisely used, the furniture is not bulky or over-bearing. The bathrooms have only a stand in shower. This location of CQ has an excellent lounge on the top floor that also includes an outdoor space, I liked this feature a lot. The lounge is a great place to unwind.At my second stay i was able to check in around noon which helped me get a room on the 15 floor with a good north facing view.This was my second time staying at the CQ, and by then i was used to quirks: Some what slow or scarce elevators, and the fact that there is no "lobby" per se. This time around there were 2 employees to help guests check in and it was short and speedy. I tired to download the App on my mobile the day before to check in electronically but hit a snag. Check out was also a cinch.When i made my booking this was the lowest price hotel that my office travel site offered. i informed my other colleagues and about 4 them stayed here too!

review_body: I was in NY on business and was booked into the Club Quarters Hotel. The location is superb and close to all the good shopping and Times Square. Everything is a short walk away - including Grand Central Station. The rooms are compact but the inclusion of a small table and bench/chair is very helpful. Cofffe in the room and snacks and coffe freely available on the 27 th floor is a nice plus. The 27 th floor lounge terrace also offers free wine from 5 pm to 6 pm every day - also a nice plus. All in all a very good hotel and very pleasant stay.

Took my newly graduated daughter apartment hunting and stayed here for the second time.The place is great. The staff is super helpful AND professional.Special shout out to PK in the bar for Happy Hour!!Front desk staff is there 24 hours and very accommodating.Restaurant has good food and prompt service!Will be staying here again!

Fantastic location! We were originally looking for a hotel not in Manhattan but then decided to save on travelling time, and this was a very good decision. Very central location made getting around easy, and also we came back to the hotel to have a lie down or drop off shopping in between sightseeing and shopping. Being so close to Grand Central station, even getting to the subway was easy, to get to other parts of Manhattan further away. The staff is great, very helpful and ready to serve and accomodate guests. Chris, the showman of the place, making sure every guest goes unnoticed, and that everyone's glass is always full at happy hour on the roof terrace of the hotel, while you take pictures of the Chrysler building almost next door. Rey, Sandy and Jevness at front desk all ready to help us with anything we needed. Our first room had a bit of a problem with the A/C but when we mentioned it to them, they changed our room with no problems at all. Elizabeth from housekeeping making sure I was getting enough shopping done and keeping me up to date with where to find the best deals. All staff was friendly and helpful, and excellent at their jobs. The rooms were very comfortable, our first room had a refrigerator and microwave, our second did not, but we didn't really feel a need for them. I would think these are especially handy for people travelling with children. The laundry room was a great extra: 2 washer/driers for guest use at no extra cost, detergent included. The only (obvious) problem is that they're pretty much always in use, so a little stalking is needed to catch one in time to get your laundry done. A small fitness room can be found if you still have enough energy after all your walking. A great choice as our honeymoon hotel, and will definitely be coming here again next time!

Our room was clean, not enough towels, staff was friendly, no big deal. Very small. This review is asking me to write more, but honestly, there is not much more to say. This hotel is in Manhattan, so don’t expect a view unless you want to see all of the pipes that are needed to operate this place. They do have a terrace which was nice.

Nice hotel, located in the heart of midtown next to Grand Central Central. In spite of a room that was not huge (compared to the american standards) there were a lot of benefits that made us appreciate our stay. Free water (refill, reuse, recycle!) a lovely terrace located at the 27th floor from which to enjoy fruit, coffee or tea, and from 5pm till 6 pm a free wine plus sneacks. All for free. We really enjoyed our romm with benefits

This is the perfect room for visiting NY. It is small but super clean and everything is exactly where you need it. The location is ideal for all things Midtown. I really enjoyed the free wine happy hour on the 27th floor outdoor patio. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.

My fiance and I stayed here on an overnight in the city after a yankee game and a broadway show. This is one of the best hotels I have stayed at in NYC. The staff was beyond friendly and helpful, room was a very good size (for NYC) with a queen bed, gorgeous updated bathroom, coffee maker in room and everything else you would need. Very quiet too! Our room was ready early which helped out tremendously, though they were happy to hold our luggage in the morning before our train as well. And the location is perfect! Steps from Grand Central and all the wonderful bakeries and restaurants on 3rd. Very easy to get all around. I cannot wait until I am back in the city and I can stay here again. We highly recommend!

This hotel came on recommendation from a friend and I am happy to note that our friendship has deepened. I spent 7 nights here so when I give a 5 star rating, it's been tested. Sure one of the three elevators also took a vacation but that's really not something that devalues the incredible service, courtesy and friendliness of the staff. David was amazing at reception so much so that I missed the friendly morning greeting on his day off. I will recommend this fine spot to any of my friends and family travelling to NYC. Oh did I mention that the location is amazing to get around and the most value for what you get in this area.

Check in area is small and crowded. Check in staff very courteous. Chris was great during Wine Happy Hour. Great Rose wine. Rooms were small but very comfortable bed. One of the three elevators was not working during our entire stay so,long wait times. Good location and will come back.

Second time staying here and the location is very convenient for our purposes. The check in staff, to include Regina, are really quite nice and do their best to assist. One elevator of the three was indeed out of service the entire five days we stayed. A special thanks to the very kind housekeeper, Toby I believe, who always ensured that our room was clean and ready for our return at the end of long days; always a smile on her face!

The hotel isn’t self was ample for a few days break; rooms small but to be expected in the city. The girls on reception were absolutely useless, out of three lifts, generally one was only in use which was pretty poor. I had a phone call from reception at 1am morning telling me that someone was on our way up to mine and my husbands room- had no idea who this was but interrupted my sleep and then was awake until 5am. Reception area cramped.

TV set was not working properly.One elevator was broken the entirely week causing much inconvenience to guests.Apartment was not properly clean upon arrival.Service and location are okay.Business center is great.

We had a great stay at Club Quarters during our July visit to the USA. Room was nice & clean, and although quite small, the layout of the room maximised the space available. We received great service from all of the staff during our stay, and especially Zishan, who assisted us with checking in, and was always happy to help ensure we had a great stay.A fantastic stay overall, highly recommended!

We enjoyed our stay at the Club Quarters near Grand Central Station. The staff were very professional and helpful. The room, although small, was clean and comfortable. There was also a roof deck with free wine and snacks during happy hour in the evening. One of the better hotels I have stayed in New York City.

The staff was nice, the room was spaceous and clean. The bed was huge and comfortable. You have a great view from the rooftop. There are free snacks and drinks available. Daily happy hour with free wine .

Definitely a terrific hotel. Outstanding service. Everyone helpful and friendly.The real surprise was the 27th floor lounge. Zabar's snacks. Gourmet coffee 24/7. Outdoor searching with view. Complaints: No comfortable chair was in the room; elevator broken the whole 10 days I was there. That meant up to 10 minute waits. But still, I highly recommend.

Perfect location for a 10 days holiday!Near the center and the subway.Nice staff, always ready.Cleaned rooms with lots of comfort.27th floor always open: you can have snacks or eat and drink tour own lunch and dinner at any time..fantastic!

This was the 2nd hotel chosen during a trip to NY which was interspersed with a trip to Gettysburg. Our first hotel was just a room where the bed occupied 90% of the space and the noise of Times Square and the corriders was very evident.Club Quarters was such a welcome contrast. From the very exhuberant welcome on checking-in to the free drinks hour between 5 and 6 there was just so much more of a human touch to the service here. For an inexpensive hotel, there were just so many nice touches to make this seem more of a community than a dormitory of seperate people.Having experienced the highs and lows of NY Hotel Life- I am no longer going to try and search out the perfect hotel when I go back. I have already found my perfect hotel.

Excellent hotel. Great location with subway and buses one block away (or 20 mins walk to Times Square) and lots of restaurants, cafes and markets nearby.Comfortable and clean room.It has a terrace on the roof with a beautiful view of the city, where you can have coffee and water at your disposal and at 17:00 you can also enjoy wine and snacks. Very good.All the staff are very friendly and attentive from the receptionists to the cleaning staff.I liked everything. I'll be right back.Excelente hotel. Ótima localização com metrô e ônibus a uma quadra (ou 20 minutos a pé até a Times Square) e muitos restaurantes, cafés e mercados nas proximidades.Quarto confortável e limpo. Tem um terraço no roof com bela vista para a cidade, onde tem café e água a vontade e as 17:00 servem também vinho e snacks. Muito bom.Todo o pessoal é muito simpático e atencioso desde os recepcionistas até o pessoal da limpeza.Gostei de tudo. Voltarei.

Fantastic stay. Will stay here again. Had view of Chrysler building and not too far of a walk from times square. Had light breakfast snacks and coffee on the rooftop patio. Front desk people were very helpful and nice.

We travelled with another couple Aug 9-Aug 13, 2018. The property was clean, the employees were helpful, and the location was great. The rooms are small but ours had a mini fridge and a microwave which was nice. The rooftop lounge with snacks and wine was a nice touch.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one week - end of June beginning of July this year - just at the start of a heatwave. Anyone reading this review with a view to considering where to stay in NY please be in no doubt that we would recommend this hotel highly. Very central yet within easy walking distance (if you like walking and we do) to many of the iconic symbols of New York - the Chrysler building, 7th Avenue, Times Square, St Patrick,s Cathedral, the Rock, the Central Library and so on. However if walking is not your thing well a hop, skip and a jump takes you to Grand Central Station and the subway will take you all over. Be sure to get a 7 day pass though and you can whizz up down, left and right as often as you like and can visit everything. Brilliant. Back to the hotel though. This is a very friendly, welcoming place where nothing is any bother to the staff therein. Furthermore the rooms are comfortable (as is the bed) and of a practical size. Good toilet/shower facilities and includes a goodly supply of toiletries. There is also a little sofa with a table in front and a supply of coffee, tea and uht milk along with a coffee maker. Television, WiFi and air conditioning completes the scene. The bonus to this venue is the lounge/terrace on floor 27. What a wonderful addition to one’s stay this turned out to be. Head up in the morning for copious amounts of coffee, tea, granola bars, bananas, apples, oranges. All free gratis. Now every evening, around 5.00 pm there was a complimentary wine reception ( red and rose), but also from the fridge could be had tins of soft drinks (I can’t remember what now which possibly tells you something!). Included were crisps and snaky things or nibbles - and very very popular this all proved to be to the guests in the hotel. We loved it. The hosts at these daily events were all lovely people (one in particular was quite a colourful character, and another one quietly charming). Regardless - they contributed and added value to the quality of our stay here. This was our second time visiting this fabulous city - flying from Edinburgh, Scotland - just to spend some time with you all. We will do it again (though not in the heat of the summer) and we would look, once again to stay at this hotel. Thank you for

I stayed here for 3 nights and it was the perfect sized room for a single or two people who spend the whole day exploring the city. Very comfortable and clean. Staff were very friendly and efficient. It’s just a few steps away from Grand Central in a great area of town with many restaurants and connections. Each floor had a guest amenities closet which was well stocked with ironing accessories and toiletries. The rooftop has an amazing view too with a very popular free wine hour. Will make this my go to city hotel for future trips.

One of the best hotels I have stayed. Free snacks, tasty and healthy. Front desk staff are nice and helpful and with courtesy and professionalism. Great location and very comfortable mattress. Definitely will return if possible.

It is a mighty cool and trendy hotel place with a warm welcome smile that greets you.Hard working and extremely friendly staff that always welcome you throughout the day.I would definitely recommend everyone to go there.

Very good location, clean and very comfortable room ( beds were really good) , plenty of space, free still water in each floor , free coffee and fruits on the 27 th floor and also free wine and snacks every day 5pm-6pm , very friendly and helpful staff.The only negative points are the little noisy air condition , and also although we were on the 17th floor there was constant little noise from the streets ( but that’s New York I believe). But the whole impression and experience of the hotel is so good, that I will give 5 stars in this hotel .

Enjoyed my stay at Club Quarters. Room was clean and well kept. Unlimited filtered water, coffee and snacks on the 27th floor. There was also a wonderful terrace to enjoy overlooking Lexington avenue. A wonderful place top stay.

The hotel is perfect for travelers, close to times square, Broadway, and everything..The reception team is the best i have seen in my life, they are better than in a 6 stars hotel.Everything in the hotel works perfectly.The 3 guys at the front desk that i have a oportunity to meet: Rey, David and Chris were just amazing to everyone.If you want to go to NY this is the place you must stay.Thank you so much, guys!

State of Rio de Janeiro

review_body: Great location, nearby The grand central, restaurants, starbucks, public library. Excellent cleaning and shower. Very kind staff and a beautiful view. The hair dryer could be better! I really like my stay and plan to return.

CQ is my home away from home when I stay in New York. Always a friendly face greeting me at the entry way. I share with my co workers while we are visiting in the area to stay at this hotel. My plan is to visit this hotel in San Fran and London.

I had a good time staying at Club Quarters Grand Central. Location was great. The staff is friendly and the wine at 5 was ending the day in a great way. Nice view from the terrace but be prepared to wait for the elevators which is my only negative point of my stay.

Fantastic location with modern conveniences. The staff is friendly, attentive and just outstanding! Chris is the wine dispenser, cheerleader and master of ceremonies for the FREE wine event every evening at 5-6. (Did I mention it's free?)Book it now.

Clean and tidy hotel with great location in Mdtown. 2 min walk to grand central, to subways and trains. You can basically walk to the uptown/midtown tourist attractions (rockefeller center, times square, bryant park etc.) Every floor had a water machine woth empty water bottles, you dont need to stack up with water from foodshops. At the rooftop is a lounge area, with coffee machine, sodas and snacks complementary by the hotel. And every day at 17 o clock was wine hour, where they served local wine, also for free. Really nice atmosphere, you could small talk with other quests or just enjoy the rooftop view. The hotel had no own breakfast area, but you can find many cafes and diners around the area. The rooms where small, like in every big city, but I've seen worse. Queen size bed, a small couch/table area, fridge and bathroom. The foodportions are big in th US, so the fridge came in handy when we wanted to take-a-way the rest of the meal from restaurant. Air conditioning was a bit loud, but it worked. No complain about the cleening, towels where changed daily. We got a room at the 17th floor, so heard no traffic noises. If you are travelling from Newark airport I would recommend to take the bus, newark airport express to bryant park and walk a couple of blocks from there. Had no complaint about the bus ride. The departure was at friday afternoon, we had reserved some extra time for the traffic so got to airport on time. All in all, we had a nice stay at this hotel, would definitelty recommend and would stay here or at another Club Quarters hotel on Manhattan again.

Booked this on a whim for a one night stay. My family and I were tremendously surprised and pleased. First of all, it is very tough to find a hotel willing to accommodate a one night stay, especially a Saturday night. The folks at Club Quarters didn't seem to mind. The price was super fair in terms of NYC hotel room prices, especially for a last minute booking. Location is great; a five minute walk from Grand Central and close to a variety of subway stops. It was easy to hop around the city with this as your home base. Check-in and checkout were a snap and they had a room ready for our early check-in.The room itself was the usual small-ish NYC hotel room. One bed with a fold out sofa bed, which might be touch for an adult to use comfortably but our teenager had no issues. We were struck by how quiet it was considering the busy midtown bustle 15 floors below.And if that wasn't enough to make us happy, we discovered the terrace on the 27th floor (open 24 hours) with beautioful three direction views of Manhattan. And the clubhouse that is attached offers snacks, sodas, fruit, coffee, etc. gratis. That, along with the ice cold filtered water machines (with bottles for those on the run) on every floor, are very thoughtful small touches that really make a difference. Well done and we hope to return soon.

My room was on the 18th floor, really clean and a beautiful view from my window, the location was perfect, just a few minutes walk from the major attraction, including Empire state building about 15 minute walk, Times Square 13 minutes, Rockefeller Center 10 minutes and most important of all Grand Central about 2 minutes, there we would take all the trains we needed for the farther trips, they have free bottled water and computers and snacks including everyday from 5pm to 6pm free wine...and the views from the 27th floor balcony were breathtaking...overall great hotel for the price. The only thing that kept me from give them the full 5 stars was that one of the elevator was out of service and sometimes we have to wait too long for the other two to get to us, other than that no complains at all....

Me and my 10 year old daughter had a great time staying here in this central location. Our room was clean and spacious, and we liked how there was a place to sit and a table we could eat at. I liked the coffee machine in my room and the complimentary cheese and wine every night at 5pm. I found the staff very helpful and friendly whenever I asked them a question. I thought the price was very reasonable! Would stay here again!

We had a fantastic stay here for 8 nights. Chose this hotel mostly for location and value for the money. Room was on the 22nd floor and in a corner. The room was clean, and had one of the most high tech TV's we have ever had. Air Condition worked well but I wish that Housekeeping would not turn the system off completely when it is 94f outside for 3-4 days in a row. This left the room hot and required the unit to run late into the night.The guest amenity closet is a great concept but... I wish the hotel would stock it with more than just a Ironing board.Again no biggie just asked the desk for what we needed.Wine at 5 and good old David entertaining everyone was a hoot. And we are not just talking sampling wine but good old fashioned pre-Broadway entertainment.Now for the negative thing:-The Guest/Self Laundry- This is something that is a huge amenity if executed properly by a hotel but in this case this was done rather poorly. Mind you it is Free(including the Detergent), but do not count on this as part of your trip. While this was not the deciding factor in choosing this hotel(Value and Location were), it has been something that was a deciding factor in the past and we were counting on laundry being available. The laundry is a home grade all in one washer/Dryer machines. This means 110V drying which takes a very long time(5-6 hours easy). The hotel has 2 of these machines and when working if you can dry a few items in your room it probably wont be a issue. However, when guests put detergent powder in the liquid dispenser or into the drum or both and plug the machines... they don't work well. I would have rather seen a paid commercial laundry like at the Villa Fontaine Tamachi on our last trip that costs 3$/load to wash and dry(plus detergent) then a free set up that 1) you cant get to 2) doesn't work. It is great that it is there... if you can get to it and use it but with one machine broken and a 5-6 hour wash cycle, it was always in use.Choose this hotel as the value and location are second to none... but don't rely on the laundry if you have a extended vacation.

It was quiet, convenient, friendly, and fantastic to be on the doorstep of Grand Central Station. The room was bigger, more comfortable and better value than others I've stayed at in New York. Loved the 5pm rooftop drinks (thank you Chris and co), and the occasional use of the washing machines. I stayed for 18 days so it felt like home for a while. Definitely recommend.

Room small but adequate, aircon good, problem on first night dealt with well. Lounge area v good for coffee and fruit in the morning. Good location, great having water and bottles available. Downsides: frequently only one of the three lifts was available, a hotel with 27 floors needs more than one lift. And at the risk of being a bit miserable, unlike other reviewers I found Chris, to put it politely, tiresome.

Excellent location in NYC so close to grand central and only a 10 minute walk to Times Square ! Service was amazing, rooms were of decent size and there is a washing machine you can use for free ! We stayed for 9 nights and loved it ! Rooftop was lovely with free snacks and coffee to go ! Great price,quality service and awesome location!

Reception called everyday trying to change my room for some reason. I refused the first day because I already unpacked but she didn’t give up calling and knocking on the door while sleeping trying to change my room. I never knew why.

Great hotel. Clean comfortable and great staff. Chris is one of the best hotel employees I’ve ever had the pleasure of being around, and I’ve been traveling for business for over 30 years. Also great location one block from grand central station.

We went to the city to visit friends and decided to stay over in order to avoid traveling twice in a day. The solitary employee in the small reception area was welcoming and very accommodating. We wanted to leave a bag with the bell hop, but as our room was ready early, he gave us the keys. We had not expected that. The room was clean and comfortable. There were a nice outdoor terrace and indoor lounge on the 27th floor, and these were comfortable and hospitable, although in NYC one does not usually choose a hotel for staying indoors, the views of the city at various hours of the day from that vantage point were fascinating. The fire alarm rang at night as a false alarm, and the night staff managed the situation well. We would certainly prefer an alarm that is sensitive over an alarm that doesn't work, so this was understandable and no inconvenience at all.

I stayed for two nights in a standard room, which was kind of small (acceptable as a single-room by New York standards) but clean and comfortable. The bed was also fine for me as a solo traveler, and I slept well on both nights. The bathroom had the usual supply of toiletries.Each floor has a bottled water station where you can fill up any time you want. The rooftop terrace is also a nice value-add with snacks and refreshments available 24 hours, and happy hour at 17:00. One also gets to meet the interesting mix of guests, from suits to young folks to families and retirees...typical of New York!Overall, definitely a recommended hotel and would stay here again, but would probably go for a bigger room if for a longer trip.

We stayed there for seven days, in two rooms. The rooms are smallish but clean. There was no safe in the room; there was a tv, a hair dryer, a small fridge, a microwave and a coffee maker. The room has plenty of power sockets to plug in the chargers. The best feature of this hotel is its roof top terrace at its 27th floor, which is connected to a large social room that occupies the entire 27th floor. The room and the terrace are open 24 hours, and has some freebies (tea/coffee, apple/orange/banana, etc). During different meal times, they put out some free snack food (granola bars, finger food etc). In the evening 5-6pm, there are free wines! This room also has three nice iMacs and one printer for everyone to use. People just sat there chatting or reading or working on computers. This social room on the top floor is the jewel for the hotel. The views from its terrace are awesome. One downside is its tiny lobby – just one person standing behind a ‘bar’ without any chair. So it could be a long wait if there are one or more people in front of you, with issues. All staff are very friendly and ready to help. Highly recommended - the hotel is in easy walking distance to Grand Central Station, and anywhere you want to go.

No frills for the single traveler, small room but quite comfortable, very good value off-season, in walking distance of Grand Central and the Port Authority terminals, and mid-town Manhattan, but the breakfast over-priced.

Hotel is in an excellent location, room was quite small but not an issue for us. Terrace was nice and check in / check out was easy. Well located for Grand Central, Times Square, Rockefeller Centre etc. Would recommend.If you're looking for a typical "diner style" breakfast then would recommend the Comfort Diner located 5 minutes walk up 45th.

Stayed here for 2 weeks on a business trip, enjoyed the laundry and workout facilities. The rooftop balcony and lounge was wonderful for getting coffee in the morning and unwinding after work. Free wine at 5 every night was also a plus. Chris and David provided excellent customer service as well.

Perfect choose and choice, if you like to visit NY by feet. Very well located. Roof Top and wifi with child (15) perfectly! Free Pepsi, Snacks and coffee is wunderful. And last but not lest: free wine at 5pm. Just a Perfect day.

It was okay, given the wrong room we had to go back downstairs to receive a new room. When we got the new room remote wasn't working and couldn't sleep becsue it was very loud. The rooms are very small and we paid too much for it.

New York City, New York

review_body: The location is well position for business and shopping. The area is not too busy and a few cafes located in the area. The hotel itself is very basic but the room was cleaned and more than adequate. Comfortable bed, simple but sufficient gym equipment and comfortable business lounge (with a lovely terrrace)

The hotel is clean, and in a great location. The staff is beyond helpful and friendly. They advertise a "manager's reception" (or something like that) beginning at 5, on 27th floor. They used to have beer and wine, and better snacks (veggies and dip, etc.), but now only offer wine, and bags of chips/pretzels, M & M's, wasabi peas, granola, and some other snacks. Soft drinks are also available. I like to exercise and the exercise room is clean, but SMALL. If there are more than 2 people in there it can be cramped.

Small hotel, good location, service great, Chris and his co workers are amazing! He is omnipresent... upstairs with the view and the complementary wine tasting, and downstairs when you come and go... always helpful... always a kind word.... great energy! He makes the trip lively....

The Club Quarters Hotel is within walking distance of the UN and Grand Central station.The staff were exceptionally accommodating allowing an early check-in after a long haul flight with no additional costs.A special shout out to Rey & Michelle for excellent service on check-in and to Jillian, Rey & David on check-outAlthough the hotel does not serve breakfast it has a well-appointed guest lounge on the 27th floor with snacks and drinks from 10H00 daily.

Our expectation was met to the fullest extent possible. From the moment we booked in, until our departure was one pleasant experience. We were booked well in advance, resulting in very favorable rates in Manhattan. Hotel Boutique/Club Quarters is strategically situated, clean rooms, friendly staff and wi-fi, all were just superb. The

This little gem of a hotel was a complete surprise. For a great price, I had a comfortable room, wonderful amenities and a truly delightful staff. From the check-in service, to the happy hour server to Elizabeth on the housekeeping staff, I felt welcomed and well taken care of. Free snacks on the outdoor patio with a view, 24/hour gym, a great restaurant in the building and a daily happy hour added to the overall experience. I will definitely make this a regular stop for future NYC trips!

Chris did the wine @ 5 and he is the best hotel host we gave ever encountered. This hotel is the one to stay at in NYC. Great service....great quarters. Thank you guys so much for your great service. We will definitely be back.

Our stay here was great! The location of the hotel is perfect. The hotel is near the central station that takes you to any point of the city where you want to go. The coolest thing is that the hotel has a terrace with a nice view where you can go in the late afternoon and they offer some snacks, coffe and wine. The staff are very attentive, friendly and to willing to help you! Super indicated!

We stayed at this hotel for a week, and we loved it. The location of the hotel is great, just near Grand central. Everyone working here were very friendly and helpful! Chris made a very good impression on us. He is very friendly, attentive, funny and made our stay even better. The hotel serves free water and free wine from 5-6 PM. The restaurant in first floor served very good food as well. Definitively recommend this hotel.

Great hotel centrally located. The staff is very attentive, friendly and very eager to help. The living Room Terrace is a very nice amenity with coffee, light snacks, wine hour, and wifi. Nice place to have a business meeting as well.Rooms vary based on your needs from single to family and are priced accordingly. Hotel tends to sell out quickly

We reserved a 1 br suite so my daughter would have some privacy. When we checked in all but one suite was available and it had a broken water pipe that the repairs would be completed the next day. The Staff was very apologetic and we stayed in one of the Superior Rooms. Had plenty of room and enough beds but the daughter had to actually live and talk with us parents. We got our suite the next day and my daughter enjoyed her newly found privacy.

I had the pleasure of working with Chris on two nights and Elizabeth for one night during the Manager's reception. Chris is very engaging and want to know you and mingles with everyone. He makes people smile and feel relaxed and at home. Elizabeth helped that effort by Chris, though she was more in the backstage, but she is was still helpful. If you are coming to this hotel, be sure to experience a relaxing hour with great personal interaction for Manager's Reception!!

Stopped for 5 nights at the Club Quarters Grand Central on 45th Street New York 18th July 2018. The hotel is entered by a single door off the street giving access to a small lobby, not giving the best impression. However there were 3 staff members present, all were friendly and helpful. The booking in took only a couple of minutes and was a pleasurable experience. We were given 2 room key cards and took one of the 3 elevators up to the 9th floor. Our room (907) was small but had enough space for the 2 of us. The bathroom was spotlessly clean and looked as though it was newly renovated. It had a sliding door deprecating it from the sleeping area. There was no bath but the shower was of a good size. There were plenty of shampoos and conditioners given daily. The rest of the room was clean and had a small wardrobe and table and chair. There was a large tv on the wall facing the bed. Our room looked out over Lexington Avenue and as with most rooms that overlook streets you could hear the traffic (and sirens and horns) throughout the night. Although the weather was extremely hot, we did not need to use the air conditioning as the room remained cool. The hotel had a snacks and relaxation area on floor 27 which had an outside area with terrific views. The snacks are free (fruit, coffee, soda, fruit bars and M&M’s) as is access to computers. The hotel is in a good location just behind the Chrysler building and across the road from access into Grand Central Station.All in all I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel and based on this visit I would stay there again and recommend it to others.

Very good location for easy access by subway or on foot to New York attractions. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room had everything you could need - including a yoga mat if you still needed to exercise after sightseeing! The free drinks and snacks on the 27th floor were a nice touch. My only negative comment would be that the mattress sagged in the middle and was probably ready for replacement.

We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, and there are some good points about this hotel. The location is great - it is just a few blocks away from the time square. The people and services were very good too. Attentive and friendly. The reason why it only gets a 3 star was the facilities which was slightly shocking. We were on the third floor with a window facing side of another building. There was literally no lights in the room. The air con was hanging inside the room and was very loud at the night..and the room was like a cupboard, almost no space to stand when I unpacked my luggage (it’s a quite large one!)I expected hotel room to be small for hotels in nyc but I believe a good 4 star hotel should offer quality facilities despite on being very small... Would recommend for a short stay due to its excellent location, but will advise my fellow travellers to stay somewhere if you are staying more than a couple of days.

i stayed for a full week in club quarter grand central, the team was so friendly, we had some issues with the room but everything was solved directly i do recommend club quarter for your stay in manhatten - It has everything you need for your stay

We stayed here for three nights and loved every minute. The rooms were super clean and trendy. The location was only a 15 min walk to Times Square. The happy hour is amazing... and our favourite part was Chris who worked it. Very informative and super friendly and hilarious!!

Super conveniently located by Grand central, super digital so can connect your tv and key card to your phone if you want. Very comfortable and helpful staff. I also liked that they have fitness programs and equipment that you can use in your room if you want. The only thing I would recommend is to get a room further from the elevator because you can hear people walking by.

We usually stay in this hotel when we visit NYC, because the location is ideal and the rates are reasonable. The rooms are lovely, nicely equipped. Unfortunately, the street noise from Lexington Ave is extreme, amplified by the tall buildings surrounding the hotel.

We spent two days in CQ Grand Central in july. The hotels location is superb, close to communications and in walking distance to central park and times square.The staff is super friendly and really goes the extra mile to make the guests feel welcome, Chris in particular. The hotels daily wine tasting was an unexpected surprise. The only negative was that the avenue outside was noisy during work day.

My boyfriend and I decided to come to NYC on vacation and our hotel and hotel staff could not have been nicer, the best part would have to be complementary wine hour, who wouldn't love that! chira was super entertaining and welcoming! Jillian was bubbly and super helpful, always making sure our days were going smoothly.

I only give four stars because the check-in process was less than smooth and a bit stressful.Otherwise, great location. Close to restaurants and shopping. There are a few convenience stores on the block for drinks/snacks. Rooftop snack room is nice with views of the Chrysler building. Very quiet room and comfortable bedding.

I strongly recomend this Hotel if you want to have a nice trip in NY. The location is very good & the social club has excllent services, views and snacks to spend fantastic conversations with other guest reviewing the day.

I have stayed in a number of CQ hotels in the city. This is, without doubt, the best of them. Aside from the very good facilities, it has some great staff. Chris is very entertaining and helpful - both at reception and on the 27th floor Club Living Room. Elizabeth - one of the maids - could not be nicer. Given she works most days until 11.00pm, I am amazed that she constantly checks when she encounters you that you are happy and have everything you need.

We were in NY on business for a week. Room is tight but well designed. Nice work area with good lighting which was a plus. Staff is friendly, welcoming, upbeat and responsive. Shout outs for Michelle (who made a special trip to see if I had left something in the room), and Elizabeth, as well as a lovely young woman who checked us in (she is studying to be an actor) and cheerfully arranged for us to move to a new room. The bonus feature is the 27th floor which is roomy and bright with coffee and snacks (and wine from 5 to 6). I spent a lot of time up there working on my computer, enjoying the space and camaraderie, the snacks, and the great view. Attracts an international clientele which is a cosmopolitan plus.

Loved the happy hour 5-6 pm; free wine and snacks!! Nice 26th floor terrace- great view ( of pouring rain! ) Here for work ; great street fair/sale on Lexington today. Filthy, humid city, but Club Quarters was a welcome refuge.

This is the fourth hotel in this price range we’ve stayed in in NYC in the past 7 years and it was the best. There were so many perks. The first was the very welcoming check in staff, who were friendly and helpful and didn’t even blink an eye that we were there an hour before check in time. The room was clean and larger for a NYC hotel. We loved the little reading lamps, Keurig, and sitting area. The bed was comfortable. Three elevators for the hotel and we never had to wait more than a minute. The amneties were awesome. Free bottled water and snacks, plus the wine hour had additional snacks. The lounge area on the 27th floor had lovely outdoor seating and a great view. There was no free breakfast but they put out extra goodies in the morning which we easily turned into breakfast. Missing one star only because the bathroom could have been slightly more clean (hair), the water pressure was abysmal (although the hotel may not bracket to do anything about it), and the coffee machine in the lounge was broken all day one day. We would definitely stay here again.

Where to start....The location is great, near central park station and 15 mins walk to empire state and central park.Room was a good size. We had 4 suitcases which did not take up much room. Shower was powerful and always had water. The aircon was good and the tv facilities were good. I was able to watch Netflix.Hotel had water fountains on each floor with water bottles. 27th floor is a must for the view and tea/coffee and free wine @ 5pm with Chris as a great host. All staff are warm and welcoming.To summarise a very enjoyable week stay. I would recommend.

This was my fist staying at club Q grand central at NYC. It was wonderful experience. We stayed that for 4 nights this time. Front desk, Rey and Chris, are both friendly and helpful. It was great location and good service. The housekeeping, Yuki, is even nice to help me finding my show I left in the room. I really appreciate Yuki's help. Good experience!

This was probably the best hotel I’ve ever stayed in, and I’ve stayed in many hotels around the world. It was nicely decorated, had many amenities, very clean, and provided excellent customer service. I could not be more happy with my stay.

I loved this hotel! The location was terrific and the area easy to navigate (once we figured out that Ave run east and west!). The subway is a couple of blocks away and super easy and reasonable to use to go just about anywhere. The 27th floor was a hit for us. We loved the free wine and the entertainment in the form of Chris. The room was a little small but really well appointed. Great bathroom, great housekeeping, good restaurants nearby - I will definitely be back! Thanks for a great four-night stay!

My room is super comfy and has all the amenities - despite being downtown NY size. Everything feels very Euro Apartment-y. Great location, safe, and the staff is SO friendly! The amenities are awesome - water purifiers and refillable bottles on every floor, gym, laundry, fridge and microwave in rooms. Oh and the happy hour at 5! David was pouring and he was the BOMB! I'll be back.

Loved the 27th floor snack station. We took advantage of the coffee/soda, fresh fruit and other snacks that were offered daily. We appreciated the fact we were able to check in early because we were absolutely exhausted upon our arrival from our very early morning flight!The hotel is within walking distance to a lot of the sights. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel.

Very well designed room/furnishings giving a great sense of space. Comfortable. Convenient to Grand Central and within easy walking distance of many attractions. Good access to trains and buses. Did not use the rooftop lounge but will on a future visit.

The hotel is located just a couple of short blocks from Grand Central Station. Room was an ok size with a booth setting around a table. The bed was comfortable but had 2 singles joined together which I loathe. I had little noise from the street which is a bonus in NY. There was no in-room safe or fridge, and an ironing board and iron is located in the corridor along with free purified water. The bathroom was ok although the shower pressure was average.Breakfast was not included but the hotel has a pretty good but expensive restaurant on the ground floor.Overall due to the quietness of the room and excellent location I’ve rounded my score up to a 4.

Elizabeth in housekeeping went over the top to satisfy a request that nobody else could. Third employee was a charm. I really appreciate her going above and beyond. Thank You Elizabeth !! I’ll be back soon !!

Our stay was excellent. The location in Grand Central is convenient to everything midtown. The staff and service at CQ are wonderful. Water bottles are provided on every floor. Best of all, we were upgraded to a suite. Simply the best!

review_body: Our stay in CQ Grand Central was great. Helpful staff, clean rooms, top floor snacks and terrace, location and CQ app to control stuff were amazing. Totally recommending to anyone who wants an affordable but great stay in NYC.

My husband and I visited New York City for a weekend to celebrate our 30th anniversary. We arrived early in the morning and were greeted with smiles and a welcoming hello. We checked in and the hotel stored our luggage while we explored the city. We booked a regular room but were surprised to hear that they upgraded us to a suite which had a microwave, small fridge, toaster, coffee maker, dishes and a sink. The living room area had a double pull out couch, a tv and a small 2 person table. On the table was a lovely note from David and Debbie along with a bottle of wine, and some treats! The room was very quiet. Every floor had water bottles that you could refill and there was a rooftop patio that had free wine from 5-6 pm daily. There was also free coffee, fruit and snacks available all day. The location of the hotel is ideal becz it is across the street from Grand central station where you can catch the subway.

The location, 2 minutes away from Grand Central Station is unparalleled. The Beds and pillows are wonderfully comfortable, the staff is friendly and cheerful at all times (shout out to Chris and Elizabeth on the 27th floor), amenities like chilled bottled water, laundry and afternoon cocktails make this a really cool place to stay. We highly recommend this hotel!

Had a fantastic 2 night stay here while I was in town to watch some Broadway shows. I had booked it based off the positive trip advisor reviews and it did not disappoint. I also got a pretty good price (for NYC). Rooms are clean and quiet, AC wasn’t noisy either which is a plus. Reception was super friendly and checked me in early at around noon before I even asked if that was a possibility. I often come for weekends from nearby so I take an early flight which makes early check in a HUGE plus for me. It was also great as I had a 2pm show to catch and it was nice to be able to freshen up before. Room and bathroom was very clean and comfortable. There were bottles and filtered water available on every floor which came in handy given the summer heat. All hotels should have this, buying and carrying back water to the hotel is such a hassle! I also liked that there was a closet with irons and ironing boards in closets on every floor that yu could go grab.The room was quiet and I slept super comfortably both nights. Location is pretty great, there is lots at walking distance and I pretty much walked to and from the theaters for all the shows I saw.Check in and check out was smooth, staff were friendly and wifi worked perfectly. The only issue was the bathroom door which was like the sliding door of a closet and may not provide enough privacy depending on who you are staying with. I had the room to myself so it wasn't an issue for me however it may be for people sharing the room. All things considered, it was a great stay for me and I would return if I could book again at a good rate!

Great hotel in a good spot close to Grand Central terminal. The room was good and the little extras are what really makes it stand out. Free wine at 5pm and free snacks all day. Unlimited free bottles of water and a couple of self operated washing machines. Staff are very friendly. We are so pleased that we stayed at this hotel.

Loved this hotel - great location, 2 minutes walk from Grand Central, and easy walking distance from Times Square (10 mins), Empire State (15 mins) and Central Park (15 mins). We had a superior room, which was quite big given the hotel's location in Midtown, the air con was really effective, and we needed it as we visited during a heatwave in July! The bed was comfy, and there are free purified water fountains on every floor, as well as ice, and free reusable bottles to take with you on the go. The top floor also has a lounge for all guests to make use of, which has a TV, plenty of sofas and chairs, free snacks, coffee, cold drinks etc all day long, and between 5 - 6pm they provide free wine, which is just what we needed after a days' walking round the city. The lounge has a lovely rooftop terrace with views up and down Lexington. The staff here are super too - from the moment we checked in, the reception staff made us welcome and were on hand to answer any query we had. During our stay we had the pleasure of Chris - who seemed to be everywhere at all times and was also the pourer of free wine,his service was excellent and he was always on top form and had everyone smiling and laughing. Also Mustafa was an excellent source of information for things to see and do in the area and gave us some great restaurant and bar suggestions for our visit. I will most certainly stay here again when I return to NYC, as I hope to do, and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Hotel was great. In a central location, friendly employees. Have free filtered water and bottles at the ice machines (very nice after sightseeing in the heat). A nice complimentary wine hour and snacks. Only negative, the room was small, but that’s to be expected in NYC. However the bathroom was a nice size.

This is one of the nicest, cleanest, quietest, and coolest hotels I’ve ever stayed at. Filtered cold water stations with free water bottles on every floor, yoga mats and free streaming yoga classes online, and a great top-floor lounge with free food and drinks and balcony. Perfect!

We stayed for one night and have been very happy.The room was clean and the size was good.Free water is available. Free Yoga Mats in everyone room. The Fitness room was clean and easy to find. The hotel is next to the Grand Central Station.Staff was very nice and helpfull.

Great hotel, convenient location for walking and transport. The bonus is a longe and roof terrace with great views and happy hour for wine at 5pm each day.Great staff, especially Chris who kept the lounge running with charm and lots of humour!

Overall, very good hotel but the fitness center is horrible. Not enough equipment and weights. Ice machine was out of order. They had no passes to use at the YMCA. But the beds were comfortable and clean.

I love staying at this hotel when I come into the city. The staff is incredible- especially Chris who is always so friendly and energetic. The location is perfect and the value can't be beat. -I highly recommend it for business or personal travel.

I was happy with my stay . Staff were friendly . The hotel was well kept and up to date . The lounge was especially nice-lots if comfy sitting areas and there was an assortment of snacks various times of the day . The location was awesome too , just around the block from Grand Central terminal . And even walking distance (20 mins ) to Ellen’s Stardust diner , (15 mins ) Rockefeller, (10mins)library , (5 mins ) Chrysler building , (10mins)Bryant Park ,(20 mins) Time square and (20 mins) Broadway .

Fantastic hotel. Any complaints on here? No idea where they’ve got them from! Lots of free snacks, drinks and wine. Rooms good value for New York. I’ve stated in a few hotels there and this is the best! Location is excellent and the rooms are cleaned to a very high standard. Went with my mother who is a cleaner and obsessive about it. She checked thoroughly and had zero complaints - a first for her!I loved it here. The staff were really polite and lovely, the amenities excellent and if I ever come back to New York this is the hotel I want to book.

We had a late check in. On arrival our check in was smooth Z (that’s how his name started, can’t remember the rest, was the one who take care of us) What a wealth of information we received from this young man Thank you so very much for all the information given. We were here for the 4th of July and he send us to the PERFECT spot to watch the fireworks. Also gave us good recommendations for dinner that night. The rooms were as expected small, but clean. Beds were comfortable and overall and all I need is clean, clean and clean.On the 27th floor great views 24 hour fresh coffee, in the mornings was pleasantly surprised to find a refrigerator with some sodas, fruits and granola bars for the guests.Across the street you will find a deli that sells bagels really good coffee and they also have food.Location for hotel can’t be beat less than ½ a block from Grand Central Station.Will definitely stay here again.

I checked in on a Friday evening. The lady that checked me in was very nice and polite. The room I was given faced the air conditioner units and brick walls; I asked to be moved to another room, but they did not have a room available. They said they would put me on a list to be moved since I was staying a couple of nights - never heard a word. Every evening, I would go around the corner from the hotel for a glass of wine (that I paid for) and during the day and in the mornings, I went to Starbucks for coffee and/or snacks (that I paid for)... My last evening at the hotel, I was chatting with a lady on the elevator and she said what a great hotel this was and I shook my head thinking... why? Then she proceeded to tell me that there was a great roof top terrace with wonderful views on the 27th floor, coffee and snacks 24 hrs, breakfast items in the mornings as well as a fabulous Happy Hour from 5 - 6 in which I was never told of. Instead of going to my room each evening; I would have sat outside and enjoyed NYC with everyone else at the hotel. I then went up to see what she was talking about and met Kevin. He was truly sorry that I had not been told of the extra's that the Club Quarters offered and he brought me a 'goody bag' to my room. He definitely exemplifies the true meaning of customer service, dedication and loyalty to the hotel chain and gets 110% in my book. I did speak with reservations when I left and I was offered a certificate to be used at a later date. It was a lot of money to spend on a hotel room without using the hotel to its fullest ~

We have really enjoyed our stay at the excellent hotel. The bed is comfortable, the rooms are quiet, especially important in the hussle and bustle of New York. We particularly enjoyed happy hour with Chris each night on the roof top terrace. Chris is lots of fun and the free wine and nibbles are delicious.

Went to nyc for July 4th with my girlfriend and decided on this hotel bc of price and location. Had a wonderful time. They allowed up to check in late due to airport issues and was extremely friendly and helpful

On 27th floor and Elizabeth expresses the spirit, as expected plus some, of what it means to be a hostess. Went out of her way to ask what she could do to help and ran do get an ice bucket for a bottle of wine so I could relax with family and enjoy the views. Elizabeth you rock! Overall checkin was easy, laid back and informative. Love CQ! Hope management gets this feedback! Much needed pat on the back!

This Club Quarters hotel is situated in the middle of New York, only a few minutes walking from Grand Central station. Nice because you have there many subways lines and also the market with fresh products so you can make your own healthy breakfast. You can eat it in the livingroom at the 27th floor of the hotel with outside a big terrace. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are OK and clean. Enough interesting places to be in walking distance like Time square etc.
